desc: about the job our client, farmers insurance,` `is one of the most established and respected insurance providers in the united states, delivering a broad range of products including home, auto, life, and commercial insurance. founded in 1928, the company proudly serves over 10 million households nationwide, managing more than 19 million individual policies across all 50 states. they are part of the globally recognized` `zurich insurance group, which oversees its non-claims operations via farmers group inc. with more than 48,000 exclusive and independent agents and nearly 21,000 employees, farmers has written over us$25 billion in gross property & casualty premiums. the company is a market leader in personal lines insurance, offering specialized solutions such as dwelling fire and seasonal property coverage, designed to meet diverse customer needs and protect what matters most. about the position were looking for a motivated and detail-oriented` `data scientist i` `to join our team. in this role, youll work on end-to-end solutions that involve building and operationalizing predictive models, conducting statistical analyses, and creating impactful visualizations that drive real business outcomes across multiple lines of business or shared service functions. youll extract and prepare data from various sources (structured and unstructured), apply advanced analytics techniques (such as clustering, pca, hypothesis testing, and resampling), and help deploy your models into production. youll also support operational tasks like data validation, managing trackers, and contributing to internal communications, all while navigating shifting priorities in a collaborative, fast-paced environment. this is a fantastic opportunity for someone early in their data science journey who is eager to grow, solve real-world problems, and contribute to high-impact projects. youll be part of a globally renowned group that values innovation, learning, and diverse perspectives. requirements must have - 1 to 3 years of experience; - experience with sql, python; - knowledge in version control with github; - experience with power bi or other data visualization tools; - entry level knowledge with modeling and machine learning algorithms; nice to have - insurance and actuarial skills; - experience working on a cloud platform (aws, azure or other) ‚Äå benefits - competitive salary and performance-based bonuses - comprehensive benefits package - career development and training opportunities - flexible work arrangements (remote) - dynamic and inclusive work culture within a globally renowned group - private health and dental insurance - pension plan - meals tickets - life insurance

desc: data analyst rio de janeiro par perfeito ‚Äì match brazil / full-time / remote [apply for this job](https://jobs.lever.co/matchgroup/8237795c-c826-48ca-8e2f-86d7665b571f/apply "‚Äå") who are we? we are the latin american branch of match group, the worlds largest company for dating websites and apps. youve probably heard of some of our brands: [match.com](http://match.com/ "‚Äå"), tinder, okcupid, par perfeito, divino amor, our time, hinge, stir, and many more! our mission is simple: to create meaningful connections for every person everywhere. passion drives us, and we believe in love. we are relentless in our pursuit to build and integrate technology that will help connect people. currently, the groups brands worldwide include: par perfeito - a pioneering brand in brazil and the largest in online serious relationships. [hinge](http://relationships.hinge/ "‚Äå") - hinge is an inclusive dating app for real people looking to meet others and pursue real-life relationships. [pof](http://relationships.pof/ "‚Äå") - a dating website for people seeking casual or serious relationships. [match.com](http://relationships.match.com/ "‚Äå") - the worlds largest dating site. [tinder](http://site.tinder/ "‚Äå") - the leading global app to meet new people. match affinity is a division of match group that drives the fastest growing dating apps. every month, millions of users come to our apps, like blk and chispa, to find matches and make great connections. as a data analyst on our product analytics team, you‚Äôll use data to understand our users -- what they need, what they do, how to retain them, and ultimately how to help them find the best dates. then you will partner with cross-functional teams to provide long-term strategic insights for our products. you will also support business trends/forecasting and model the financial impact of new product ideas.  - a strong knowledge querying massive and complex datasets,analyzing, and driving key and actionable insights - working with other cross-functional teams like finance, crm, engineering and business intelligence; proactively engage other teams to identify and drive better user experience - providing internal consulting to product management, marketing, finance, and crm teams on a/b tests as they move initiatives from concept to market - presenting technical content across business stakeholders - working as the product owner of revenue and retention strategies for the product - serving as the subject matter expert on applying various statistical methodologies towards distilling actionable insights - researching issues about customer behavior/changes by analyzing relevant metrics, trends and supporting enterprise level initiatives - supporting these products: chispa, blk, upward, yuzu  you might be a match if: - 3+ years of hands on sql (or structured data) experience along with advanced excel skills - exposure to applied statistics (descriptive statistics, statistical testing, design of experiments, linear modeling, time series analysis etc); python/spss/sas/r experience a plus - self-starter with good communications skills - you have experience going beyond number-crunching, reports, and dashboard creation -- you are able to understand the business impact of the data and make recommendations based on your findings - excellent problem solving skills - bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in statistics,economics, computer science, engineering related field, marketing, or mba with quantitative focus - experience in product analytics supporting digital applications including mobile apps & consumer internet is preferred - fluent in english  - please submit your cv in english why work with us? our mission is simple - to help people find love and happiness! we also take great care of our employees. here at match group latam, youll have: \-autonomy to develop in a light, fun, and technological environment that encourages innovation through technology; \-flexibility for work and hours; \-competitive salary package and bonuses, according to company policy; \-competitive meal voucher/meal allowance; \-health and dental plan, extendable to spouse and dependents for employees (not included for interns); \-gympass to take care of your health even more; \-home office assistance: every month you will receive an allowance to contribute to home office expenses; \-incentive to participate in events; \-udemy for business: youll have access to the udemy platform, which offers over 183,000 online courses in various areas, on-demand; \-in-company english: we have an in-company english teacher to help develop your second language. the company covers 80% of the costs and the employee covers 20%; \-annual check-up: to take care of our teams well-being, we offer an annual medical check-up for all employees aged 40+, promoting health and well-being through preventive medicine; \-"baby bonding leave" - extended paternity leave. here at match, we believe that caring for the next generation is a gender-neutral investment. as soon as an employees baby is born, the father takes 100% paid leave for 12 weeks. \-international career opportunities: we have several cases of employees who have been expatriated to contribute to match group in other countries. here, you have the autonomy and freedom of a local company, with the structure and resources of a global corporation. we hope you feel excited to join our team, with the autonomy to bring your ideas to life without worrying about bureaucracy and rigid hierarchies. so, did you like it? how about helping people find love and happiness with us? _if you require a reasonable accommodation to participate in the hiring process ‚Äî such as during pre-employment testing or interviews ‚Äî please indicate this by selecting ‚Äúyes‚Äù in the accommodation request field. we‚Äôll reach out to discuss your needs if youre selected for the interview stage._

desc: about the job working at bitso we are a diverse team that takes pride in understanding the perspectives of others. we fully embrace working remotely and we are eager to act, improve and accelerate progress inside and outside of our organization. to drive revolutionary changes in society and make crypto useful, we delight our customers with world-class products, deep care, and intentional empathy. your purpose` ` as a data analyst at bitso, youll do more than crunch numbers‚Äîyoull be at the heart of our mission to make crypto useful. join our data analytics & research (dar) team and transform complex data into actionable insights that shape our products and drive our data-driven culture. this is a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in both business analytics and experimentation, with dedicated mentorship in a supportive, remote-first environment. if youre ready to learn and make a real-world impact, we encourage you to apply. reports to analytics manager at the data analytics & research (dar) team. who you are a data analyst who is eager to learn, highly analytical, and comfortable working with structured data to derive basic insights and support experimentation. you will execute sql queries, build dashboards, and assist in simple a/b tests and survey analyses under close guidance. must-have qualifications: ‚Äå - bachelor‚Äôs degree in economics, actuarial science, computer science, statistics, or a related field. - intermediate knowledge of sql. - experience building and maintaining dashboards (e.g., looker, excel, google sheets). - strong written and verbal communication skills in english and spanish. - collaborative mindset: communicates findings clearly to your immediate team and squad. ‚Äå core competencies: ‚Äå - data extraction & bi: execute sql queries for data extraction; define and track basic kpis. - dashboards & reporting: build standard dashboards; maintain documentation of metrics. - exploratory analysis & insights: conduct basic exploratory analyses to identify initial trends and patterns; answer well-defined business questions. - causal inference support: basic understanding of a/b testing; assist in monitoring simple experiments and product roll-outs; help prepare experiment reports. - survey design & analysis: basic understanding of survey data; summarize pre‚Äëcollected survey responses (frequency tables, cross-tabs). - statistical foundations: understands statistical concepts - collaboration & scope: delivers assigned tasks with clear guidance; focuses on specific datasets or reports; works effectively within the dar squad. ‚Äå what you will do` ` ‚Äå - core analytics & bi - write and optimize sql queries to extract, clean, and validate data from our warehouse. - build and maintain operational dashboards in looker/excel/google sheets. - define, document, and track a set of basic kpis for key business areas. - exploratory analysis & insights - conduct initial data exploration to surface trends, anomalies, and potential opportunities. - answer ad‚Äëhoc, well‚Äëscoped business questions using available data. - causal inference & experimentation support - assist in the setup and basic monitoring of a/b tests and product rollouts. - prepare simple experiment reports (e.g., conversion rate lift, basic statistical summaries). - survey analysis - summarize pre‚Äëcollected survey responses; generate frequency tables and cross‚Äëtabulations. - create clear, concise summaries of survey findings for stakeholders. - team collaboration & delivery - communicate results and recommendations clearly to your immediate team and squad. - deliver on assigned projects with clear guidance, focusing on defined deliverables and timelines. [_research_](https://hbr.org/2022/07/apply-to-a-job-even-if-you-dont-meet-all-criteria "‚Äå")` `_in diversity, equity, and inclusion suggests that individuals may hesitate to apply for jobs if they do not meet all the listed criteria. at bitso, we value diversity and your unique strengths could be just what were looking for. if this role excites you but you dont match every point in the description, we still want to hear from you._ who we are with over 9 million users, bitso is the leading cryptocurrency platform in latin america. we are developing the cryptocurrency ecosystem in the region and enabling financial inclusion. we believe crypto is the future of finance, and we‚Äôre committed to making it useful by providing equal access to safe and intuitive financial products. when we hire people for our team, we specifically test for the following traits in addition to our cultural values: ‚Äå - mission-driven: we seek individuals who are passionate about crypto and bitso‚Äôs mission and resilient in facing industry challenges - high sense of urgency: we prioritize candidates who demonstrate a high sense of urgency and responsibility. - exceptional hard skills: we seek individuals who possess exceptional skills in their respective fields, with no room for mediocrity. - self-management: we look for individuals who can independently manage their work, career, and professional development.` ` ‚Äå compensation & benefits at bitso, you are taking the front seat on the edge of crypto innovation, creating the next generation of crypto-powered products. so for those willing to commit, adapt and pioneer the most important change of the century we offer: ‚Äå - me time program, including unlimited paid time off. - remote-first work environment. - employee stock option program. - zero trading fees through our bitso alpha app. - extended family leave policy: all birthing parents, non-birthing parents and adopting parents are eligible for a 4-months leave. - premium health, dental and life insurances in mexico, gibraltar, colombia, usa, brazil and argentina. - monthly stipend for gym memberships, relaxation activities, sports equipment, cooking classes, books, entertainment and more. ‚Äå want to leave an undoubtedly legacy with us? fasten your seatbelt and join this spaceship, where you will find exponential growth and the opportunity to thrive! ‚Äå - these are the applicable requisites, although equivalent competencies in any of the above will also be considered. - to see our privacy policy please click` `[here](https://bitso.com/terms "‚Äå").

desc: about the job founded in 2017, reps & co. has rapidly become a leader in data analytics in the entertainment industry. recognized on the forbes list of americas best startup employers, we focus on delivering advanced analytics that supports data driven decisions. our solutions provide comprehensive insights and forecasts, enabling us to have a better understanding and response to supply and demand in the ticketing world. with a commitment to driving innovation, reps & co. helps shape a dynamic market environment. we are seeking a highly motivated, self-starting data engineer with a strong sense of ownership and an insatiable desire to learn. in this individual contributor role, you will design, build, and optimize robust data pipelines and scalable architectures that drive our business forward. if you thrive in fast-paced environments, love solving complex problems, and enjoy exploring new technologies, you‚Äôll fit right in with our team. were looking for a business intelligence analyst, tasked with transforming data into key insights supporting the revenue management team. this position will be responsible for partnering with business stakeholders to measure our business, communicate trends, and improve our pricing processes with data-driven automation. a candidate must be a highly motivated, positive, organized self-starter who can work well with a variety of tasks and adapt quickly. some initial projects may include designing and visualizing new kpis for the analyst team to assist them in making pricing decisions, analyzing large datasets to identify trends and opportunities, and optimizing existing data infrastructure. key duties & responsibilities - identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets - build reporting that displays actionable insights for the rm analysts and leaders, and other stakeholders and be able to communicate results of analysis across various audiences - provide recommendations to the business by interpreting disparate data and translating ad hoc requests to consistently deliver relevant and impactful results - serve as a liaison between the reporting & analytics team and the event management team to understand data needs - ensure quality control over data, analyses and metrics - identify flaws and errors in the data and any upstream data issues ‚Äå requirements: - critical thinker - the ability to determine the best way to structure data, measure and display performance metrics - strong written and verbal communication skills; comfortable presenting data-heavy information in clear and concise manner to all levels of the organization - comfortable with and adaptive to change - inquisitive & analytical - search for meaning and patterns in data - organized & strategic - align analysis/reporting with business needs - takes initiative - proactively communicates with team and identifies areas of opportunity - experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment - 2-4 years bi experience with tableau or similar tools - 2-4 years bi experience with alteryx or similar - 2-4 years of experience using sql and a deep understanding of relational databases - excel experience - python experience preferred, not required ‚Äå education: - bachelors degree in a quantitative field; business background preferred ‚Äå _available to work in the pacific time zone_` ` _remote work_

project management methodologies, the software development lifecycle, and the insurance industry. the advanced analytics department focuses on developing automated and modern ai systems to integrate with core business processes. ‚Äå at mec, we foster a friendly, results-oriented work environment. we value employees who are proactive, adaptable, dependable, and enjoy collaborating as part of a team. our ideal candidate is eager to explore new challenges and gain exposure to code management, report automation, documentation, and requirement gathering in addition to core technical data science skills. this internship provides an excellent opportunity to expand your knowledge, skills, and professional network. ‚Äå key functions include but are not limited to: data management - ensure needs of internal and external stakeholders by delivering reports and electronic files as required. - participate in code reviews and validate code results through thorough analysis of data outputs. ‚Äå professional exposure - engage in a professional environment, interacting and networking with staff and leadership. - observe and contribute to all stages of the model and application development lifecycle, including planning, requirements gathering, development, and testing. - develop a foundational understanding of information technology, particularly in relation to data, data warehousing, etl processes, and data mining. - gain insight into project management practices and methodologies, including both waterfall and agile approaches. ‚Äå technical tools - demonstrate proficiency in microsoft technologies such as sql server, power bi, and the office suite. - utilize other applications effectively, including vs code, python, github, jira, and confluence. - exposure to cloud and generative ai tools and solutions  qualifications - applications should be working toward an undergraduate or master‚Äôs degree with a focus in data science, statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related fields. - clearly demonstrates and models wr berkley and midwest innovation behaviors. - highly self-motivated and self-directed. - passion for working with data to solve problems. - proficiency with excel; experience with database querying a plus. - proficiency with a programming language; python is preferred - strong analytical and critical thinking skills. - ability to communicate data insights verbally and visually. - proficiency in offering and actively engaging with constructive feedback. this is a year-round internship based in a hybrid in-office setting at our chesterfield location.  additional company details we do not accept any unsolicited resumes from external recruiting agencies or firms. the actual salary for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment.  sponsorship details sponsorship not offered for this role

desc: about the job at weave, analysts are key strategic thought partners who generate insights to elevate our business across product strategy, customer health, and business growth. in this role, you will play a key part in driving product strategy and decision-making by providing data-driven insights into user behavior, product performance, and market trends. you will collaborate closely with product leaders, product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to identify opportunities for product improvement and innovation. your analysis, recommendations, and dashboards will inspire action within the product organization and impact the companys growth trajectory. - this position will be remote based in brazil or mexico. - reports to: director of data & insights. what you will own - product success measurement: defining and measuring product success kpis (mau, adoption, retention, churn, etc...) to drive insights and product growth. - strategic thought partnership: proactively contribute a data-driven perspective to the development and refinement of product strategy, acting as a key thought partner to our product organization. - data-driven product optimization: leverage dashboards and data analysis to inform and optimize product strategies, with a strong track record of evaluating the impact of new features and enhancements - data analysis and visualization: analyze complex data, identify key trends, and communicate findings through clear, impactful visualizations. - key dashboards: develop and maintain key product dashboards using sigma that improve self-service initiatives across the product organization.` ` what you will need to accomplish the job - bachelors degree in a field such as statistics, computer science, data science, business analytics, or a related technical discipline. - 5+ years of product analytics experience, preferably in b2b. - proficiency in sql with experience querying complex, large-scale datasets. - advanced analytics techniques relevant to product analysis, such as behavioral analytics, segmentation, experimentation (a/b testing), and predictive modeling. - expertise in data visualization principles and proven ability to create clear, compelling, and actionable dashboards and analysis. - proven experience communicating intricate data insights and strategic recommendations with clarity and conciseness to diverse audiences. - proven history of owning and driving analytical projects from inception to impactful delivery, managing timelines and identifying opportunities for. what will make us love you - experience with sigma or similar data visualization tools. - experience with pendo or similar product analytics tools. - you are a highly analytical and strategic thinker with a strong business acumen and a demonstrated bias for action. - you are a deeply curious self-starter and have strong capabilities in managing analytic projects, prioritizing analyses, and making insightful recommendations. - you can quickly deliver valuable business insights with solid technical skills. weave is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where all individuals are valued and supported. we welcome anyone who is hungry to learn, problem-solve and progress regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. if you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. _all official correspondence will occur through weave branded email. we will never ask you to share bank account information, cash a check from us, or purchase software or equipment as part of your interview or hiring process._

desc: about the job ‚Äå progress rail‚Äôs data science team is looking for a motivated and talented data scientist who will primarily focus on developing machine learning/artificial intelligence based data models for condition-based monitoring of its assets. in this role, the candidate will contribute to the design, development and deployment of world class rail products and services vital to our customer‚Äôs needs. reporting to the director of data science, this role will enable innovative, strategic, and high-tech solutions for the rail industry through the application of specialized knowledge, skills, and abilities. work involves independent judgement, problem solving skills, resourcefulness, teamwork, and creativity in ambiguous situations. a high degree of personal initiative is a prerequisite. typical data science team efforts are a combination of some, or all the key job elements listed below. ‚Äå the ideal candidate is an experienced self-starter, strong attention to details, with excellent written and verbal skills. enjoys working in a collaborative, fast-paced, environment and is willing to take on roles outside of comfort zone. technical aptitude and being well versed in machine learning and data science tools and processes is a must. the role will work closely with the different engineering teams. ‚Äå about us: as a caterpillar company, progress rail is one of the largest integrated diversified providers of locomotive, freight car and infrastructure solutions and technologies for the global rail industry. our teams deep industry expertise ensures a commitment to quality through innovative solutions. ‚Äå key job elements - contribute to the design, development, testing, and deployment of software systems and applications. - processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis. - apply machine learning and other advanced analytical techniques to develop models for condition-based monitoring of locomotive systems. - apply natural language processing (nlp) and large language model (llm) to support text mining, document summarization and others. - understand the business needs and develop data-based solutions. - doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner. - supporting field reported issue resolution through data analysis. - system integration of machine learning models. ‚Äå qualifications and education requirements ‚Äå - b.s, m.s, or phd degree in quantitative discipline such as data science, data analytics, computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics, or other related degree. - data science experience with b.s. or experience with advanced degrees. - experience with python, sql, and relational data bases. ‚Äå ‚Äå technical skill - experienced data scientist with experience in data extraction, data modelling, data wrangling, statistical modeling, data mining, machine learning and data visualization. - expertise in transforming business resources and requirements into manageable data formats and analytical models, designing algorithms, building models, developing data mining, and reporting solutions that scale across a massive volume of structured and unstructured data. - proficiency in managing entire data science project life cycle and actively involved in all the phases of project life cycle including data acquisition, data cleaning, data engineering, features scaling, features engineering, testing and validation and data visualization. - expertise in applying machine learning algorithms (such as regression models, xgboost, neural network, and others) for predictive analytics. - experience in developing llm based solutions for document search/summarization using rag architecture. - experience in natural language processing (nlp) and text mining. - expertise in applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc. - strong experience with python. experience with sql is preferred. - experience and knowledge of aws cloud which includes aws container services, s3, and others. - experience in integrating machine learning models into larger deployed systems. - proficiency in data visualization tools such as powerbi and python matplotlib to create visually powerful and actionable interactive reports and dashboards. - strong business sense and abilities to communicate data insights to both technical and non-technical clients. - competent to perform all job duties without close supervision. desired: - rail industry experience. - experience in developing models using telematics (sensor) data from equipment such as engines, machines, and others. ‚Äå language: advanced english. direct interface with global teams. reporting to a director in the us. ‚Äå soft skills: - compatibility with` `our values in action` `(caterpillar code of conduct); - autonomy: being able to manage yourself, deal with a large number of tasks and solve minor problems proactively and responsibly. - creativity: proposing innovative and original solutions in order to add value to processes and increase the companys competitiveness. - communication: can clearly express ideas, thoughts and concepts in order to influence others or gain support. - analytical ability:` `the ability to analyze data and information, regardless of their the relationship between them, to enable logical decision-making, based on data. ‚Äå additional information: the selection process will be carried out through cv analysis, interviews, a technical test and professional profile mapping (disc). ‚Äå what we are offering for this position: - clt contract - health insurance for you and your dependents - dental plan for you and your dependents - meal vouchers - food voucher - life insurance - application for discounts at gyms - application for discounts on medicines in pharmacies - plr - profit sharing - private pension plan - continuing education allowance - extended maternity and paternity leave ‚Äå those interested in participating in the process should send their resume to` `[_rh.campinas@progressrail.com_](mailto:rh.campinas@progressrail.com "‚Äå")` `or apply through the simplified application on linkedin.
name: Data Scientist - Progress Rail Brasil - Linkedin

desc: about the job ‚Äå company description at 300 software, we believe in the concept of less is more. we help our partners fill in project gaps with the matching set of skills they need. with that in mind, we carefully select talented, experienced, and result-driven professionals to incorporate into their teams and develop successful solutions. ‚Äå role description this is a full-time remote role for a data analyst. the data analyst will be responsible for gathering and analyzing data, performing statistical assessments, and creating data models. the role also involves interpreting complex datasets to assist in strategic decision-making and communicating data insights to stakeholders. this is an opportunity to work on complex data pipelines and datasets, generate actionable insights, and make a tangible impact on company performance and customer satisfaction. ‚Äå collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will analyze financial trends, promote robust data governance, and identify areas to optimize business performance. the ideal candidate will bring strong analytical expertise, a deep understanding of financial markets, and the technical skills to translate complex data into clear, impactful insights. ‚Äå key responsibilities: - data management: collect, clean, and organize large datasets from diverse sources, including financial transactions, market data, and customer records, while ensuring data accuracy and integrity. - insight generation: analyze quantitative data to uncover trends and relationships, delivering actionable insights to support business strategy and decision-making. work in teams with marketing, product managers, and engineers to design, run, and analyze experiments to improve user experiences. - reporting excellence: develop and maintain interactive reports and dashboards using tools like power bi, domo, or excel to provide stakeholders with clear and timely data insights. perform ad-hoc analysis to answer specific business questions; provide actionable insights; and support data-driven decision making. - financial modeling: build and refine financial models that assess risk, project profitability, and forecast potential outcomes, aiding strategic planning and investment evaluations. - risk analysis support: partner with the risk management team to track and enhance key risk indicators (kris), empowering proactive and informed decision-making. - process optimization: identify and implement data-driven process improvements to enhance operational efficiency, reduce costs, and boost productivity. - data governance: uphold data management best practices, ensuring compliance with industry regulations such as gdpr, pci-dss, and other financial regulations, while safeguarding customer and company data and maintaining robust data validation processes. - cross-functional collaboration: collaborate with teams across finance, operations, it, and risk management to align insights with business goals and support initiatives. - performance monitoring: track and analyze kpis, presenting findings through clear visualizations and reports that highlight areas for business enhancement. ‚Äå qualifications: - education: bachelor‚Äôs degree in finance, economics, statistics, data science, computer science, or related fields. advanced degrees are a plus. - experience: 2-4 years in data analysis or financial analysis, preferably in financial services (e.g., banking, insurance, fintech). - technical proficiency: - strong sql skills for data querying. - expertise in data visualization tools: power bi, domo. - advanced excel skills (pivot tables, v-lookups, financial functions). - familiarity with statistical software (r, python) and financial modeling. - knowledge of etl processes and data warehousing principles is a plus. - analytical skills: proven ability to conduct in-depth analysis and interpret large datasets, delivering insights that drive strategic decisions. - communication: clear and concise communicator who can translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations for non-technical stakeholders. - attention to detail: high accuracy in data analysis and reporting. - certifications: cap, microsoft certified: data analyst associate, cfa, or frm are advantageous. - industry insight: knowledge of financial markets, kpis, and risk indicators. experience in the collections and recovery industry is preferred.
name: Data Analyst - 300 Software - LinkedIN

desc: about the job ‚Äå about us ‚Äå ab inbev is the leading global brewer and one of the world‚Äôs top 5 consumer product companies. with over 500 beer brands, we‚Äôre number one or two in many of the world‚Äôs top beer markets, including north america, latin america, europe, asia, and africa. ‚Äå about ab inbev growth group ‚Äå created in 2022, the growth group unifies our business-to-business (b2b), direct-to-consumer (dtc), sales & distribution, and marketing teams. by bringing together global tech and commercial functions, the growth group allows us to fully leverage data and drive digital transformation and organic growth for ab inbev around the world. in addition to supporting well known global beer brands like corona, budweiser and michelob ultra, the growth group is home to a robust suite of digital products including our b2b digital commerce platform bees, on-demand delivery services ze delivery and tada delivery, and table top beer keg perfectdraft. we are an exceptional team, focused on understanding and supporting consumer and customer needs, harnessing new technology, and scaling growth opportunities. ‚Äå what youll do: ‚Äå - support the creation and maintenance of dashboards and kpis, using basic` `_sql_` `knowledge. - analyze data to help build dashboards and define relevant indicators. - work collaboratively with different departments to understand business needs. - assist in designing dashboards that clearly communicate analysis and insights. - collaborate with the team to implement data-driven strategies that contribute to business growth. - present findings and recommendations clearly to stakeholders. - pursue continuous learning by participating in trainings and team knowledge exchanges. ‚Äå what youll need: ‚Äå - ongoing or completed undergraduate degree in engineering, marketing, statistics, economics, or other data-related fields. - previous experience in data analysis is desirable (internships, academic or professional projects). - basic knowledge of` `_sql_` `and interest in learning data visualization tools such as` `_power bi_` `or similar. - desirable knowledge in statistical analysis and experimentation (a plus, but not mandatory). - good communication skills and ability to work well in a team. - strong organizational skills to manage tasks, prioritize demands, and meet deadlines. - attention to detail and critical thinking to validate data, review queries, and ensure the quality of deliverables. - willingness to learn, grow, and develop in the data field. ‚Äå more about you: ‚Äå - creative in problem-solving and constantly seeks to improve processes and solutions. - able to communicate clearly to identify needs and potential improvements. - takes initiative to learn new tools and adapt to team priorities. - organized in daily activities, keeping track of tasks and deadlines. - meticulous and detail-oriented, consistently reviewing their own work and striving to deliver high-quality results. ‚Äå what we offer: ‚Äå - performance based bonus - attendance bonus - private pension plan - meal allowance - casual office and dress code - days off - health, dental, and life insurance - medicines discounts - wellhub partnership - childcare subsidies - discounts on ambev products - clube ben partnership - scholarship - school materials assurance - language and training platforms - transport allowance ‚Äå \rules applied ‚Äå equal opportunity & affirmative action: ‚Äå ab inbev growth group is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. we do not discriminate based upon of race, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. the following fields are optional, but anticipate the information for your registration. remember: your data will never be used as elimination criteria in selection processes. with them, ab inbev growth group is able to analyze diversity and reduce biases in selection processes. we want to contribute to changing this reality by being an inclusive company. ‚Äå for more information:` `[www.abinbev.com](http://www.abinbev.com/ "‚Äå")

we currently have more than` `2 million healthcare professionals` `in our database, totaling approximately` `10 million patient` `evaluations to date. our mission is to ‚Äúhelp people live longer, healthier lives‚Äù through a diverse range of services, we are able to serve different audiences: our marketplace, which allows patients to schedule and evaluate appointments and doctors at any time of the day or night; and our saas system (software as a service) aimed at optimizing office management, patient flow and online bookings. all this through an internet platform and our ios/android apps. job description as a data migration analyst, you will play a crucial role in the companys operations, focusing on` `processing and analyzing data to be imported into our systems from our clients‚Äô, in a saas context. üöÄ what you will do in this role - execute the data migration from a given file (from simple to highly complex) provided by the client into our saas; - provide support to employees and clients by resolving data import-related issues; - identify and report bugs in the internal import tool, tracking progress until final resolution; - create innovative solutions (including script development) to enhance operational efficiency, customer satisfaction, and team productivity; - ensure data security and confidentiality by implementing strict data security practices and policies; - actively collaborate with the team, assisting them in solving complex problems, documenting processes, and providing technical support as needed; - test and validate new solutions developed, offering constructive feedback to promote continuous process improvement. qualifications üí™ what makes you a strong fit: - experience with data-centric roles that require extensive technical knowledge; - some experience with technical and non-technical customer-facing interactions; - intermediate english (written and spoken) - plenty of interaction with international teams! - advanced excel and sql skills; - knowledge of programming logic, ideally with languages like python or r; - analytical thinking and the ability to solve complex problems; - ownership, time management skills, and a sense of urgency. üòÉ its even better if you have... - a higher education degree in it-related fields (e.g. data processing, software engineering); - experience working in a saas company with a fast-paced environment. additional information our working hours are from` `monday to friday, from 9 am to 6 pm; and our benefits - we have compensatory time off (banco de horas); - vale-transporte; - food/market voucher; - medical, dental, and group life insurance; - pet plan; - ifeel app, for emotional comfort; - gympass for you and up to 3 people! - creditas: payroll loan services, eligible after 6 months of employment; - stock options - eligible after 6 months of employment (5 years grace period). - birthday day off; - daycare assistance; - partnership club, with discounts ranging from teaching institutions, such as colleges and language learning services; - referral program offers up to r$600 per person who stays with us for more than 6 months; - leave of absence/time-off: in the event of the passing of loved ones, we offer 10 days off; if your pet passes away, we offer 2 days. got married? 7 days of rest! did the baby arrive? we offer 30 days for dads and 6 months for moms; other information contract type:` `clt. workplace location:` `remote (everywhere else in brazil) -` `were especially interested in rio and curitiba applications! _we promote and embrace equal opportunities in our hiring process, and also every day at work. when you apply for our roles you receive equal treatment regardless of age, disabilities, gender reassignment, marital or civil partner status, pregnancy or parental status, race, color, nationality, ethnic or national origin, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation or any other dimension of human difference. if you require additional support in your recruitment process, we kindly encourage you to let us know. behind those words you‚Äôre reading, there‚Äôs a person (hi!) who already helped a candidate by adapting the interviews, and now we‚Äôre lucky to have this person with us. so, even if you‚Äôve never asked for it before, may this serve_

desc: about the job ‚Äå job title: impact management associate (data analyst) location:` `remote ‚Äì based in brazil, colombia or peru reports to:` `chief innovation & operations officer (ci&oo) status:` `full-time ‚Äå organization profile: nesst is an international non-profit organization with offices in latin america and europe. nesst invests in social enterprises (‚Äúse‚Äù) that generate dignified jobs for people most in need. we use an engaged approach providing tailored financing and one-on-one business development support to social entrepreneurs in emerging markets. through their businesses, social entrepreneurs empower people in their communities with the hard and soft skills, technology and ongoing support they need to improve their livelihoods and create dignified futures. nesst currently manages a loan fund that actively invests in social enterprises looking to raise capital from $50k to $500k. the fund provides senior, secured debt to profitable companies looking to scale their operations to have a stronger and more sustainable social impact. the loan fund has activities in peru and colombia and is growing into other countries in south america, including brazil. find out more about nesst: [http://www.nesst.org](http://www.nesst.org "smartcard-inline") ‚Äå position overview nesst is currently looking for a data scientist/analyst to support its global operations and impact measurement efforts. this person will play a key role in structuring, analyzing, and visualizing organizational and impact data to improve decision-making across nesst‚Äôs programs. they will work closely with leadership, program, and portfolio teams to ensure data is accessible, actionable, and aligned with our mission to generate dignified employment in marginalized communities. the impact management associate will contribute to the development and improvement of data tools and processes, assist in building predictive models, and help communicate impact in compelling and evidence-based ways to internal and external stakeholders. they will also collaborate on the creation of a standardized impact measurement tool to be used by nesst‚Äôs portfolio companies. the position reports to the chief of impact and operations officer (ci&oo) and will work in close coordination with team members across nesst‚Äôs countries of operation, with potential for travel depending on project needs. we‚Äôre looking for someone passionate about data, with a strong foundation in statistical modeling and data visualization, and who can communicate complex information in a way that is engaging and accessible to diverse audiences ‚Äî including our board, donors, management, portfolio team, portfolio enterprises and broader stakeholders. ‚Äå key duties and responsibilities ‚Äå - identify valuable data sources and automate data collection processes. - clean, pre-process, and structure both qualitative and quantitative datasets. - analyze large datasets to uncover patterns, trends, and actionable insights. - build predictive models and machine learning algorithms to improve decision-making. - collaborate on the development of a tool to measure impact across nesst‚Äôs portfolio companies. - design effective data visualizations and dashboards using tools such as power bi or tableau. - produce regular reports for internal and external audiences (board, donors, partners). - work with program managers to design and evaluate performance metrics. - contribute to the strategic development of data policies and governance within the organization. - support the integration of data tools (e.g., salesforce) across operational areas. - translate complex findings into simple language for communication and training purposes. - support the team to review companies‚Äô quarterly and annual impact reporting - support the team with metrics and methodology, as needed ‚Äå qualifications & requirements ‚Äå - proven experience as a data scientist or data analyst or impact management analyst/associate, preferably in the nonprofit or social impact sector. - strong understanding of statistics, data mining, machine learning, and operations research. - experience with data visualization and business intelligence tools (e.g., power bi, tableau). - proficiency in programming languages such as python, r, sql is a plus. - familiarity with crm and data management platforms like salesforce. - strategic thinker with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. - ability to synthesize and present data in a clear, engaging, and accessible way. - excellent written and verbal communication skills; strong technical writing ability. - comfortable working independently and collaborating across remote, multicultural teams. - strong attention to detail and organizational skills. - bachelor‚Äôs degree in data science, computer science, statistics, engineering, or related field; advanced degree is a plus. - knowledge of social impact measurement frameworks is a plus. - excellent verbal and written skills in english to be an effective communicator among diverse internal and external audiences; - familiarity with metrics, impact management and data analysis. - good verbal and written skills in spanish would be a plus. nesst offers a competitive salary with benefits in the non-profit sector. the non-monetary compensation includes a unique opportunity to be part of a meaningful global organization that is changing the world by investing in emerging market businesses that offer employment, sustainable income and improved quality of life for people who face the most significant barriers to work. a dynamic and purpose-driven international team. the opportunity to shape how nesst measures and communicates its impact. flexible, remote work with a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion. location: any nesst country in latam. schedule: 9 am ‚Äì 6 pm with one-hour lunch break - remotely start date: august 2025 ‚Äå ‚Äå to apply, please upload: ‚Äå - a thoughtful cover letter in english explaining why youre the right fit for this role. please mention any specific experience in analysing investment opportunities and conducting financial analysis of those opportunities. - resume in english - deadline for application: july 22nd, 2025 ‚Äå _nesst is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer committed to identifying and developing the skills and leadership of people from diverse backgrounds._

desc: descri√ß√£o completa da vaga about the position ‚Äå we‚Äôre building a smarter, more accountable go-to-market engine‚Äîand we need data to drive it. from partner recruitment and campaign optimization to scaling our bdr programs and play-based selling motions, performance visibility is no longer a nice-to-have‚Äîit‚Äôs essential. as the gtm program data analyst at watchguard, you will play a critical role in the collection, analysis and reporting of critical information that will drive revenue focused programs forward. this gtm program data analyst will bring analytical rigor and technical depth to our revenue marketing team, with a primary focus on supporting our global bdr program. the secondary focus areas will contribute to high-impact gtm initiatives, such as play performance tracking, partner onboarding analytics, funnel optimization, and bundle success metrics. this role is ideal for someone technically fluent, commercially aware, and excited to build data systems that drive visible business impact. this role reports to the sr. manager, sales plays and gtm activations. this team rolls into the broader revenue marketing team, enabling cross-functional engagement with marketing operations, demand generation, sales enablement and global business development. you‚Äôll be guaranteed to learn from these diverse perspectives, grow in your understanding of global business practices and needs, and have a lot of fun along the way. ‚Äå a day in the life ‚Äå the primary responsibility of the gtm programs data analyst is to support our global business development team. you will meet regularly with the bdr manager to review the teams weekly kpis, track progress towards monthly and quarterly meeting and revenue goals, and provide insights into areas of focus and improvement. this role will also regularly support lead/account assignment for the bdrs to ensure timely reach out and follow-up. this role will have the ability to assess current processes, define efficiencies and requirements, and work directly with the it team on the development of improved workflows. on a project-basis or as needed, the gtm data analyst will also support broader data initiatives across the revenue marketing team. this could include working on sales play adoption and performance, partner recruitment target account progression and pipeline, and campaign performance to name a few. this will provide exposure to other teams, functions and data, enabling diverse experience and opportunity for growth. ‚Äå bdr program analytics & reporting - ‚Äå build and maintain dashboards tracking key metrics like meetings booked, show rate, pipeline influence, and contact engagement - investigate anomalies in crm/reporting tools, troubleshoot discrepancies, and collaborate with ops teams to resolve issues - driving lead management and account ownership processes forward, and identifying areas for efficiency and scalable - serve as the key contact to drive projects and initiatives forward and align with the sales ops and sfdc it teams - partner closely with bdr manager to surface insights that shape daily operations and quarterly planning - manage list clean-up, account assignment for bdrs and target accounts broader revenue marketing & gtm program analytics - measure sales play adoption, track conversion metrics, and help identify high-performing motions - analyze partner recruitment funnels and activation rates to help optimize targeting and onboarding - support launch tracking and bundle-specific kpis and segmentation - provide inputs for campaign retrospectives, business reviews, and executive-level reporting ‚Äå experience - ‚Äå 1‚Äì3 years of experience in an analytics or marketing data role (internships, research, or academic projects count) - proficiency in sql or excel/google sheets - experience with bi tools like tableau, looker, or power bi for building dashboards - strong communication skills‚Äîyou know how to turn data into decisions, not just charts - a mindset focused on problem-solving, curiosity, and follow-through - familiarity with salesforce reporting and crm data structure - experience building dashboards or reports in 6sense for account intent or campaign performance - experience supporting or working directly with bdrs, sdrs, or inside sales teams - knowledge of sales enablement platform (outreach, salesloft, etc.) usage and performance reporting (sequence conversion, touch analysis) is a plus - previous exposure to play-based gtm models or partner marketing initiatives

desc: about the job ‚Äå job summary pyyne is seeking a mid-level data scientist with experience in the financial services sector to work as a consultant out of our brazilian office. this is a high-impact role for pyyne as we rapidly expand our data science practice globally. ‚Äå ultimately, a successful candidate in this role will guide data-driven investment decisionmaking and improve outcomes through improved end-to-end ml model development and deployment. the ideal candidate is motivated to work on a new team and is excited to work in a consulting and implementation capacity with our clients to deliver novel solutions. ‚Äå key responsibilities - develop and validate machine learning models using structured and unstructured data sources - work with business stakeholders to interpret model results and refine features - collaborate with data engineering to optimize pipelines for data transformation, ingestion, and model deployment - translate complex findings into clear insights for stakeholders through dashboards, reports, and presentations - ensure model interpretability and adherence to ethical ai practices in a regulated financial environment ‚Äå must have skills - python (for ml, pandas, pytorch), - sql (advanced skills including joins, aggregation, window functions, ctes) - excellent problem-solving and analytical skills ‚Äå nice to have skills - experience working with financial services, business teams, or operations - experience in end-to-end ml model development and deployment - strong communication skills with both technical and non-technical audiences - advanced degree in data science, statistics, computer science, or a related field ‚Äå benefits - salary range from 42,000-57,600 usd/yr - health and wellness benefits. - career development opportunities in a fast-growing company. - fully remote role
name: Data Scientist - Pyyne - LinkedIn

desc: about the job join our team oowlish, one of latin americas rapidly expanding software development companies, is seeking experienced technology professionals to enhance our diverse and vibrant team. as a valued member of oowlish, you will collaborate with premier clients from the united states and europe, contributing to pioneering digital solutions. our commitment to creating a nurturing work environment is recognized by our certification as a great place to work, where you will have opportunities for professional development, growth, and a chance to make a significant international impact. we offer the convenience of remote work, allowing you to craft a work-life balance that suits your personal and professional needs. were looking for candidates who are passionate about technology, proficient in english, and excited to engage in remote collaboration for a worldwide presence. about the role we are seeking a` `data analyst` `with strong analytical skills and business acumen to join our growing team. this role will play a key part in turning data into insights that support business decisions, performance optimization, and strategic initiatives. if youre passionate about data, metrics, and solving real-world problems, this is a great opportunity to make a measurable impact. must to have - 2+ years of experience in a data analyst or similar role - strong proficiency with excel, sql, and at least one bi tool (power bi, tableau, or looker) - experience with data cleaning, wrangling, and visualization - ability to translate business questions into structured analyses - familiarity with python or r for data analysis is a plus nice to have - experience working with cloud-based data warehouses (e.g., bigquery, redshift, snowflake) - background in statistics, economics, or business intelligence - experience working in agile or remote teams benefits & perks home office; flexible hours competitive compensation based on experience; career plans to allow for extensive growth in the company; international projects; oowlish english program (technical and conversational); oowlish fitness with total pass; pet adoption incentive; pto bonus; games and competitions; you can also apply here website: [https://www.oowlish.com/work-with-us/](https://www.oowlish.com/work-with-us/ "smartcard-inline") linkedin: [https://www.linkedin.com/company/oowlish/jobs/](https://www.linkedin.com/company/oowlish/jobs/ "‚Äå") instagram: [https://www.instagram.com/oowlishtechnology/](https://www.instagram.com/oowlishtechnology/ "smartcard-inline")
name: Business Data Analyst - Oowlish - LinkedIN

desc: about the job what is teachable? teachable is trusted by creator-educators around the world to grow their impact and income. from online courses and communities to memberships and downloads, teachables digital learning products help creator-educators drive meaningful connection and sustainable revenue. with industry-best ecommerce tools, easily toggled on directly within the platform, creators can confidently maximize their earnings, while getting paid directly by their audience. teachables unmatched focus on the student learning experience also ensures creators can make a positive and influential impact on their communities‚Äîentirely on their own terms. today, tens of thousands of creator-educators use teachable to share their knowledge, reaching millions of students around the world. to learn more, visit [http://teachable.com](http://teachable.com "smartcard-inline") . are you ready to join a dynamic, cross-cultural team at an exciting turning point in our company‚Äôs journey? now part of the global` `[hotmart company](https://www.hotmart.co/ "‚Äå")` `portfolio,` `whose platforms have helped creators earn more than $10 billion,` `teachable continues to take the creator economy by storm as a true industry leader. together, teachable and hotmart are delivering market-leading products that prioritize creator control and flexibility, alongside meaningful partnership and support from our team. if you have big ideas, relish the chance to challenge convention, and deeply believe in the power of creators to shape the future, we want you on our team! about your team at teachable, our data team aims to support company data-driven decision-making. reporting to the head of data, you will collaborate with business and product teams to validate hypotheses, answer complex business questions, help the company in uncertain scenarios, perform data experiments, and disseminate actionable insights. about you you have experience with bi tools, are comfortable navigating databases and writing sql queries, and are always looking for ways to improve reporting processes and deliver value through data. this is a fully remote role based in brazil, and you‚Äôll collaborate closely with teams across the u.s. and brazil. your work will follow brasilia standard time, and you‚Äôll be hired as a` `clt contract employee` `with compensation in` `brl. in this role youll: - build and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualizations that support key business decisions. - analyze datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement - translate business questions into data analyses and communicate findings in a clear, actionable way. - collaborate with stakeholders across teams (e.g., marketing, sales, product) to understand data needs and define metrics. - ensure data quality and consistency by validating sources and collaborating with data engineering when needed. - continuously improve reporting processes and advocate for data-driven decision-making within the company. what youll bring: - 2+ years of experience within business intelligence and/or data analysis. - proven experience in business intelligence, data analysis, or related roles. - strong proficiency in sql and experience working with relational databases. - familiarity with bi tools such as sigma, power bi, or similar. - proficiency in sql for extracting data directly from source systems. - strong communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams. - a problem-solving mindset, attention to detail, and a drive to make processes more efficient. - enjoy working in a dynamic environment with fast learning and deliveries. - advanced english proficiency (conversational, listening, writing.) nice to have: - ability to perform data cleaning and processing steps using python or r languages. - data modeling is a plus. additional details: at teachable, we are committed to providing fair and competitive pay (using market data to inform our pay bands), rewarding high performance, and ensuring all employees have the opportunity and ability to impact teachable‚Äôs overall company value. salaries will be reviewed at regular intervals throughout the year, typically following performance review cycles currently conducted bi-annually or in conjunction with a promotion. while teachable maintains our ny office for local employees to use, we operate as a` `remote-first culture` `in order to give our employees added flexibility. in order to maintain connection and create a community beyond the screen, teachable holds in-person events throughout the year, where employees and teams can come together for bonding, strategic alignment, goal-setting, and celebrations! _teachable encourages individuals from a broad diversity of backgrounds to apply for positions. we are an equal opportunity employer, meaning were committed to a fair and consistent interview process. please tell us in your application if you require an accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job._
name: Data Analyst II (L3) - Teachable  - Linkedin

desc: about the job about sezzle: with a mission to financially empower the next generation, sezzle is revolutionizing the shopping experience beyond payments, blending cutting-edge tech with seamless, interest-free installment plans that make shopping smarter and more accessible. we‚Äôre not just transforming payments; we‚Äôre redefining how people discover, interact with, and purchase the things they love while driving real impact on merchant sales through increased conversions and higher order values. as we continue to shape the future of fintech and retail, we‚Äôre building an innovative, dynamic team passionate about creating more than just a transaction but a truly unique shopping journey. if you‚Äôre excited about pushing boundaries in tech and delivering a game-changing experience for consumers and merchants alike, come join us at sezzle and help create the future of shopping! compensation: sezzle is a remote u.s.-based company listed on the nasdaq. this is a full time remote salaried position. our salary range is as follows: - $2,000 - $4,500 usd gross per month (based on experience and performance during the process) about the role:` ` sezzle is currently seeking a product data analyst to enhance business outcomes through analytics. this role presents an exciting opportunity to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment within a rapidly growing team, with abundant prospects for career advancement. in collaboration with business team leaders, youll contribute to the formulation of monitoring metrics and performance objectives. your responsibilities will include writing sql queries, contributing python code, generating charts, and developing dashboards. while your primary work will be with the product team, you will also get opportunities to support initiatives across various departments such as engineering, finance, sales, marketing, support, legal, or people operations. key responsibilities include: - work closely with business teams to understand their priorities and analytics needs - create sophisticated analyses and reporting to provide insights at scale that support growth strategies and empower data-informed decision-making - visualize and articulate analytics results to make it easy for stakeholders to interpret and take actions - help stakeholders identify new opportunities through data analysis - create, monitor, review, and analyze reports and dashboards, take initiative to fix issues that arise and conduct root cause analyses minimum requirements: - degree in statistics, math, actuarial science, economics, data science, computer science or related quantitative discipline - 3+ years of professional experience working with data, which can include: complex dataset creation, reporting, profiling, and machine learning - expert in using sql to extract data and create actionable data sets - experience with python for data processing and analytics - ability to complete analyses with minimal guidance - experience with data visualization tools such as redash, tableau, looker or power bi - comfortable making impactful decisions in a fast-paced and sometimes ambiguous environment, able to pivot quickly to new priorities - attention to detail and ability to multitask - excellent problem-solving skills - strong business judgment and communication skills - fluent in english preferred knowledge and skills: - graduate degree in a quantitative discipline - experience optimizing operational and financial performance - experience in payments, financial services, banking, fintech, bnpl the tech you‚Äôll work with: - python - redshift, postgresql - data build tool (dbt) - aws, g suite, mac interview process: - online cognitive assessment - online coding assessment - conversation with our recruiter - verbal case study interview. share how you approach new problems. a ‚Äúhow would you‚Ä¶‚Äù conversation - verbal behavioral interview. share your problem-solving experience. a ‚Äútell me about a time when you‚Ä¶‚Äù conversation about you: - a+ character. we are team-first here at sezzle. - a hard-working mentality. there is still a lot to build. - an excellent communicator. - a fun attitude. life is too short. we can have fun while we work hard on cool things. - smarts. we need people that are smart enough to make decisions on their own and also smart enough to know when they need input from others.` ` about you: - you have relentlessly high standards - many people may think your standards are unreasonably high. you are continually raising the bar and driving those around you to deliver great results. you make sure that defects do not get sent down the line and that problems are fixed so they stay fixed. - you‚Äôre not bound by convention - your success‚Äîand much of the fun‚Äîlies in developing new ways to do things. - you need action - speed matters in business. many decisions and actions are reversible and do not need extensive study. we value calculated risk-taking. - you earn trust - you listen attentively, speak candidly, and treat others respectfully. - you have backbone; disagree, then commit - you can respectfully challenge decisions when you disagree, even when doing so is uncomfortable or exhausting. you have conviction and are tenacious. you do not compromise for the sake of social cohesion. once a decision is determined, you commit wholly. - you deliver results - you focus on the key inputs and deliver them with the right quality and in a timely fashion. despite setbacks, you rise to the occasion and never settle. what makes working at sezzle awesome: at sezzle, we are more than just brilliant engineers, passionate data enthusiasts, out-of-the-box thinkers, and determined innovators. we believe in surrounding ourselves with only the best and the brightest individuals. our culture is not defined by a certain set of perks designed to give the illusion of the traditional startup culture, but rather, it is the visible example living in every employee that we hire.
name: Product Data Analyst - Sezzle - LinkedIn

desc: about the job voxy, founded in 2010, is a trailblazing language training platform tailored to meet the specific language needs of international organizations. with a mission to enhance productivity, foster collaboration, and unleash human potential, voxy has established itself as a global leader in the field of corporate language education. with a robust foundation and an ever-evolving vision, voxy has supported corporate clients across 150 countries by delivering live language coaching led by certified instructors and an expansive library of role-specific courses that bridge critical soft and technical skill gaps. today, voxys impact spans the globe, with dedicated teams operating across multiple regions, including the united states, brazil, chile, mexico, thailand, spain, italy, and ireland. originally focused on providing english language instruction, voxy has evolved to offer an array of languages, including portuguese, spanish, italian, german, and french, catering to a diverse range of learners. we believe that learning a language should be fun, rewarding, and a gateway to the best experiences life has to offer.` `if you agree, we‚Äôd love to talk. you can see more details about our values here ( [https://voxy.com/about-us/](https://voxy.com/about-us/ "‚Äå") ). we are seeking a technically proficient data analyst to join our product operations team. in this role, you will build data frameworks and systems to optimize product performance, improve user experience, and support strategic decision-making. you will work closely with product, engineering, customer success, and business teams to assess the impact of products and services, identify opportunities for growth and efficiency, and transform roi storytelling for the organization. what youll be doing:` ` - collaborating with product and engineering teams to track feature adoption, identify pain points, and measure the success of new product launches. - partnering with customer success and sales teams to analyze customer feedback and identify trends that impact user engagement and retention. - automating data extraction and transformation processes to improve efficiency and scalability. - managing and optimizing data pipelines between different sources, ensuring seamless data flow and integration across platforms. - working on backend data processes to improve data accessibility and usability for cross-functional teams. - ensuring data quality and governance by implementing best practices in data management. - analyzing and interpreting product usage data to provide actionable insights that drive decision-making. - developing and maintaining dashboards and reports to monitor product performance and key business metrics. - working with large datasets, ensuring data accuracy and consistency across multiple sources. - building data models and queries to support ad hoc and recurring analyses. what are we looking for? - technical skills: proficiency in sql and experience with data visualization tools (e.g., tableau, looker, power bi). - programming: experience with python, r, or other scripting languages for data analysis is a plus. - data management: familiarity with cloud-based data warehouses (e.g., bigquery, snowflake, redshift). - data pipelines: experience working with etl processes and integrating data from multiple sources. - analytics & problem-solving: strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights. - communication: ability to present findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. - experience: 2+ years in a data analytics or product analytics role, preferably in a saas or b2b technology company. - education: bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., data science, business analytics, computer science, statistics, or a related discipline). what else would be nice to have?` ` - experience with tools in our data stack: tableau, amazon redshift, pendo, salesforce, marketo. - experience working with api integrations and backend data processes. - background in edtech or experience demonstrating efficacy of educational products. in addition to a rewarding job that that will directly impact how millions of students learn english, working here, you‚Äôll enjoy: - competitive salary and stock options - great benefits: medical insurance, cell phone & wifi reimbursement, home office & wellness budget, team events - remote friendly work policies - professional development budget - language classes with voxy - work with an awesome international team of super bright, creative, talented, and passionate individuals based around the world we believe in a workplace that is meant for everyone. voxy is an equal opportunity` `employer. voxy believes that a creative, engaged and diverse team can transform the market and positively impact peoples lives through education. we are sure that the mission of building the most effective way to learn english is done with a plurality of ideas and points of view, which is why we work to promote diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives in our company. in addition to training, benchmarking, and community partnerships, we also work in alignment with our internal deib committee. as a reflection of our beliefs around inclusion in the workplace, our selection process has no restrictions; our goal is to assemble a diverse team that will help us be leaders in our market. we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

industry giants and innovative startups alike. you will be unraveling complex business requirements, sculpting sophisticated machine-learning models, and weaving data magic to create actionable insights. armed with your profound knowledge of data science and machine learning, your role is to inject creativity and maintain superior standards in our energetic, tech-driven sphere. if youre passionate about building solutions that push the boundaries of whats possible with data, this is the place for you. ‚Äå what will i do? ‚Äå data product development: you will develop, deliver, and insights for business-oriented people. ‚Äå required skills and qualifications: ‚Äå data science expertise: at least 4 years of experience wielding data science and machine learning to create powerful, scalable solutions. ‚Äå api integration: hands-on experience deploying machine learning models through rest apis. ‚Äå programming proficiency: mastery in python or r oriented to data science. ‚Äå database dynamo: experience with sql databases for in-depth data analysis. ‚Äå version control virtuoso: familiarity with version control systems, such as git. ‚Äå language luminary: advanced level of your earnings to suit your financial goals. ‚Äå tech-driven tools: access cutting-edge resources for seamless collaboration and productivity. ‚Äå autonomous workflow: take control of your schedule to hesitate to apply!
