desc: about the job ae studio is a mid-sized startup from california and we are looking for data scientists/developers/designers to work remotely and/or from our office in florian√≥polis. we have a highly skilled team building products to increase human agency using the most recent technologies for startups as well as large companies like samsung and berkshire hathaway. we have an awesome work environment and a highly productive process. we deploy the proceeds from our consulting work in development and data science and our` `[skunkworks proceeds](https://ae.studio/blog/we-built-and-sold-a-startup "‚Äå")` `to support research into cause areas we think are of paramount interest to human beings. we have` `[made a name](https://ae.studio/neurotechnology-consulting "‚Äå")` `for ourselves in cutting-edge` `[brain computer interface](https://ae.studio/brain-computer-interface "‚Äå")` `(bci) r&d, and now we want to replicate past successes and solve the` `[problem of ai alignment](https://yoshuabengio.org/2023/07/25/my-testimony-in-front-of-the-us-senate/ "‚Äå")` `(aligning future powerful systems with human best interests). we want to optimize for human agency, if you feel similarly, please apply to support our research efforts. data scientists will have the opportunity between client projects to work on important alignment research, with the opportunity to potentially have your research project prioritized if particularly promi we are looking for someone with strong problem-solving skills and self-management skills. about you - fluency in python - have used it on a number of projects - proven data science experience (primary or equal contributor to either a single large or multiple smaller data science analyses or products, working with a team / stakeholders) - genuine comfort with the sorts of statistics and methods used in classification problems - familiarity with nlp/nlu - experience calling machine learning apis via rest or client libraries - real agile experience (worked with kanban, scrum, extreme programming) - [growth mindset](http://www.aaronsw.com/weblog/dweck "‚Äå") - willingness to learn our systems - full-time availability - demonstrated ability to work independently/autonomously - ability to communicate effectively and work exclusively in english. (this is a must) bonus points for - experience with self-managed data science projects - software development background - experience working with / building / training deep learning-based computer vision or nlp models or llms - javascript / node.js experience - clean code, unit tests - experience managing clients and client relationships a big plus - experience in startups recruiting note - there are an increasing number of scammers out there that are taking advantage of our companys name to scam people with fake offers that result in you ultimately giving the scammers money. please make sure anyone who contacts you is contacting you from the domains ae.studio, [agencyenterprise.com](http://agencyenterprise.com "‚Äå"), [http://agencyenterprisestudio.com](http://agencyenterprisestudio.com "smartcard-inline") (please make sure that the sender really is from those domains). if you have any questions about any interviews or offers you might have received and seem bogus, please contact recruiting-offers@ae.studio. equity working at ae means receiving equity in some of our client projects and in the skunkworks projects we incubate. the equity granted is priced at a value of $0 when you receive it. if it were otherwise, you‚Äôd be forced to pay taxes. but to be clear, there are no free lunches, only the choice of who pays for your sandwich. at ae, the equity you receive is not free to ae. we invest millions annually in skunkworks projects - paying our employees to build technology for which no client pays a bill. we receive equity from certain clients, which means we accept less in terms of our billable rate. we then pass that equity on to our employees. sure it‚Äôs priced at $0 on day 1 - a call option on a stock trading at $100 with a strike price of $100 is priced at $0 today for tax purposes, but you‚Äôd want to receive that option. if you received that option on a dozen stocks, you‚Äôd be fairly confident that some of them would be worth a lot more than $0. offering this equity (by investing in skunkworks or offering clients a lower rate) comes out of ae‚Äôs margins. theoretically, we should be lowering salaries to compensate. but we‚Äôre competitive on that front as well. over the long-term, we believe ae employees who stick around are likely to fare extremely well monetarily (no legal promises). we think long-term. you should too when you choose your employer. we are looking to hire people who think long term. people create` `exponentially more value here in their 3rd or 4th year` `rather than their 1st or 2nd, and that only increases. the value you create leads to more equity issued every year, and you retain it while you remain at ae or at a skunkworks co that spins out, in order to free up equity for others, which is how we afford to be generous with the equity. - disclaimer: if you leave ae on good terms, you can retain 20% of your equity if you continue to send leads our way, share our core values, etc. if you leave ae for your own ae-incubated skunkworks project (or someone else‚Äôs), you retain 100% of your equity. folks create exponentially more value here in their 3rd and 4th years than their 1st or 2nd - we want folks who think long-term like we do. location - florianopolis office/ brazil remote

desc: about the job what is teachable? teachable is trusted by creator-educators around the world to grow their impact and income. from online courses and communities to memberships and downloads, teachables digital learning products help creator-educators drive meaningful connection and sustainable revenue. with industry-best ecommerce tools, easily toggled on directly within the platform, creators can confidently maximize their earnings, while getting paid directly by their audience. teachables unmatched focus on the student learning experience also ensures creators can make a positive and influential impact on their communities‚Äîentirely on their own terms. today, tens of thousands of creator-educators use teachable to share their knowledge, reaching millions of students around the world. to learn more, visit [http://teachable.com](http://teachable.com "smartcard-inline") . are you ready to join a dynamic, cross-cultural team at an exciting turning point in our company‚Äôs journey? now part of the global` `[hotmart company](https://www.hotmart.co/ "‚Äå")` `portfolio,` `whose platforms have helped creators earn more than $10 billion,` `teachable continues to take the creator economy by storm as a true industry leader. together, teachable and hotmart are delivering market-leading products that prioritize creator control and flexibility, alongside meaningful partnership and support from our team. if you have big ideas, relish the chance to challenge convention, and deeply believe in the power of creators to shape the future, we want you on our team! about your team at teachable, our data team aims to support company data-driven decision-making. reporting to the head of data, you will collaborate with business and product teams to validate hypotheses, answer complex business questions, help the company in uncertain scenarios, perform data experiments, and disseminate actionable insights. about you you have experience with bi tools, are comfortable navigating databases and writing sql queries, and are always looking for ways to improve reporting processes and deliver value through data. this is a fully remote role based in brazil, and you‚Äôll collaborate closely with teams across the u.s. and brazil. your work will follow brasilia standard time, and you‚Äôll be hired as a` `clt contract employee` `with compensation in` `brl. in this role youll: - build and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualizations that support key business decisions. - analyze datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement - translate business questions into data analyses and communicate findings in a clear, actionable way. - collaborate with stakeholders across teams (e.g., marketing, sales, product) to understand data needs and define metrics. - ensure data quality and consistency by validating sources and collaborating with data engineering when needed. - continuously improve reporting processes and advocate for data-driven decision-making within the company. what youll bring: - 2+ years of experience within business intelligence and/or data analysis. - proven experience in business intelligence, data analysis, or related roles. - strong proficiency in sql and experience working with relational databases. - familiarity with bi tools such as sigma, power bi, or similar. - proficiency in sql for extracting data directly from source systems. - strong communication skills and ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams. - a problem-solving mindset, attention to detail, and a drive to make processes more efficient. - enjoy working in a dynamic environment with fast learning and deliveries. - advanced english proficiency (conversational, listening, writing.) nice to have: - ability to perform data cleaning and processing steps using python or r languages. - data modeling is a plus. additional details: at teachable, we are committed to providing fair and competitive pay (using market data to inform our pay bands), rewarding high performance, and ensuring all employees have the opportunity and ability to impact teachable‚Äôs overall company value. salaries will be reviewed at regular intervals throughout the year, typically following performance review cycles currently conducted bi-annually or in conjunction with a promotion. while teachable maintains our ny office for local employees to use, we operate as a` `remote-first culture` `in order to give our employees added flexibility. in order to maintain connection and create a community beyond the screen, teachable holds in-person events throughout the year, where employees and teams can come together for bonding, strategic alignment, goal-setting, and celebrations! _teachable encourages individuals from a broad diversity of backgrounds to apply for positions. we are an equal opportunity employer, meaning were committed to a fair and consistent interview process. please tell us in your application if you require an accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job._

and constantly prove it with huge conversion lifts in tests. the data science integrations team ensures that we run successful a/b tests at scale while minimizing manual engineering effort. the team owns the customer onboarding process from a data quality standpoint, verifies the quality of customer integrations and tracking, and ensures that constructor algorithms work as expected when ramping out tests to live customers the team consists of a mix of data analysts & data engineers. as a member of the data science integrations team, you will use world-class analytical, engineering and data desc: descri√ß√£o completa da vaga voxy, founded in 2010, is a trailblazing language training platform tailored to meet the specific language needs of international organizations. with a mission to enhance productivity, foster collaboration, and unleash human potential, voxy has established itself as a global leader in the field of corporate language education. with a robust foundation and an ever-evolving vision, voxy has supported corporate clients across 150 countries by delivering live language coaching led by certified instructors and an expansive library of role-specific courses that bridge critical soft and technical skill gaps. ‚Äå today, voxys impact spans the globe, with dedicated teams operating across multiple regions, including the united states, brazil, chile, mexico, thailand, spain, italy, and ireland. originally focused on providing english language instruction, voxy has evolved to offer an array of languages, including portuguese, spanish, italian, german, and french, catering to a diverse range of learners. ‚Äå we believe that learning a language should be fun, rewarding, and a gateway to the best experiences life has to offer. if you agree, we‚Äôd love to talk. ‚Äå you can see more details about our values here ([https://voxy.com/about-us/](https://voxy.com/about-us/ "‚Äå")). ‚Äå we are seeking a technically proficient data analyst to join our product operations team. in this role, you will build data frameworks and systems to optimize product performance, improve user experience, and support strategic decision-making. you will work closely with product, engineering, customer success, and business teams to assess the impact of products and services, identify opportunities for growth and efficiency, and transform roi storytelling for the organization.  what youll be doing: - collaborating with product and engineering teams to track feature adoption, identify pain points, and measure the success of new product launches. - partnering with customer success and sales teams to analyze customer feedback and identify trends that impact user engagement and retention. - automating data extraction and transformation processes to improve efficiency and scalability. - managing and optimizing data pipelines between different sources, ensuring seamless data flow and integration across platforms. - working on backend data processes to improve data accessibility and usability for cross-functional teams. - ensuring data quality and governance by implementing best practices in data management. - analyzing and interpreting product usage data to provide actionable insights that drive decision-making. - developing and maintaining dashboards and reports to monitor product performance and key business metrics. - working with large datasets, ensuring data accuracy and consistency across multiple sources. - building data models and queries to support ad hoc and recurring analyses.  what are we looking for? - technical skills: proficiency in sql and experience with data visualization tools (e.g., tableau, looker, power bi). - programming: experience with python, r, or other scripting languages for data analysis is a plus. - data management: familiarity with cloud-based data warehouses (e.g., bigquery, snowflake, redshift). - data pipelines: experience working with etl processes and integrating data from multiple sources. - analytics & problem-solving: strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights. - communication: ability to present findings in a clear and concise manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. - experience: 2+ years in a data analytics or product analytics role, preferably in a saas or b2b technology company. - education: bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field (e.g., data science, business analytics, computer science, statistics, or a related discipline).  what else would be nice to have? - experience with tools in our data stack: tableau, amazon redshift, pendo, salesforce, marketo. - experience working with api integrations and backend data processes. - background in edtech or experience demonstrating efficacy of educational products.  in addition to a rewarding job that that will directly impact how millions of students learn english, working here, you‚Äôll enjoy: - competitive salary and stock options - great benefits: medical insurance, cell phone & wifi reimbursement, home office & wellness budget, team events - remote friendly work policies - professional development budget - language classes with voxy - work with an awesome international team of super bright, creative, talented, and passionate individuals based around the world we believe in a workplace that is meant for everyone. voxy is an equal opportunity employer. voxy believes that a creative, engaged and diverse team can transform the market and positively impact peoples lives through education. we are sure that the mission of building the most effective way to learn english is done with a plurality of ideas and points of view, which is why we work to promote diversity, equity and inclusion initiatives in our company. in addition to training, benchmarking, and community partnerships, we also work in alignment with our internal deib committee. as a reflection of our beliefs around inclusion in the workplace, our selection process has no restrictions; our goal is to assemble a diverse team that will help us be leaders in our market. ‚Äå we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.

desc: about the job a abertura atual √© para a artefact do brasil, estamos em modelo free office.` ` who we are at artefact brasil, we believe in and live a culture based on empathy! a healthy work environment is a place where all voices are heard, respected, and valued. we are committed to building a more diverse and inclusive environment, because empathy is for everyone, regardless of ethnicity, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or religious belief. we want incredible minds and hearts with us! come and be artefact! what you will be doing you will join our data and consulting team, which helps clients transform and improve their data strategy by applying advanced analytics to generate insights that create business value from big data and artificial intelligence. - innovate. you will work with your team, consisting of consultants, data scientists, and engineers, to identify client needs and define innovative solutions. - learn and share. you will work in a collaborative team that promotes knowledge sharing. you will learn from others, share knowledge, and stay up to date with industry news/updates - develop. you will be involved in the solution from start to finish. with the help of senior scientists, you will manage the design and implementation, as well as optimize performance and scalability. - work across the entire project value chain (data collection and processing, exploratory data analysis, application of machine learning models, model production) - demystify technical terms or solutions for more business-oriented profiles, can work in a team with very diverse profiles - prioritize your tasks, respect deadlines, and raise your hand in case of risks or problems what we are looking for having completed an undergraduate course in data science, machine learning, mathematics, computer science, statistics, engineering, economics, or a related field. - desirable a first knowledge in statistics and programming (python/r). - curiosity: you are always looking for innovative solutions for your clients. you are involved in the entire value chain. - collaboration: knowledge sharing is essential for you and you actively participate in the dissemination of information within artefact. - entrepreneurship: you bring solutions, new ideas, innovations. - fluent english: you are comfortable communicating in english, as it is essential for working in our international environment what we offer - vr/vt - free office (work from home or wherever you want!) - gympass - insurances: life, health, and dental - bi-monthly meetings (the famous ‚Äúget together‚Äù where we meet to be together, with workshops, lectures, training, and that happy hour!) - woba (you can choose to work in coworking wherever you want!) - semi-annual evaluations (with promotion opportunity) why you should join us - a master‚Äôs degree in machine learning, mathematics, computer science, or related fields - hands-on experience developing and applying data-driven solutions in a corporate or consulting setting, preferably in a consumer marketing context (experience in the web industry is a plus) - strong knowledge of data processing, data modeling, algorithms, and data architecture - intellectual curiosity and excellent problem-solving skills, including the ability to structure and prioritise an approach for maximum impact why you should join us - artefact is the place to be: come and build the future of the data fiel - progress: every day offers new challenges and new learning opportunities - culture: empathy and collaboration are in our dna - entrepreneurship: you will join a team of motivated entrepreneurs. we wont give up until we make a big difference in this industry! join us!

desc: about the job about nubank nu was born in 2013 with the mission to fight complexity to empower people in their daily lives by reinventing financial services. we are one of the world‚Äôs largest digital banking platforms, serving millions of customers across brazil, mexico, and colombia. about the role a finance data analyst is close to many different tasks of the finance area, allowing the person that joins an overview of the financial operations and the many products that nubank has to offer. the daily activities is to ensure the delivery of reliable and auditable data for various purposes, such as accounting, regulatory, planning, among others. by taking a proactive approach, the finance data analyst will help maintain our platforms as cohesive, efficient, and scalable. their contributions will enhance the accuracy and timeliness of financial data, supporting our teams mission to deliver high-quality and accessible financial information. you will be responsible for - understanding, designing and developing the financial needs for accounting, regulatory or other financial processes; - creating data processes through the usage of spark scala in databricks notebooks and/or etl; - mapping data sources by talking with different stakeholders in the organization; - generating reports related to financial information products, through the use of large databases and data visualization tools that contribute to the access of dynamic and accessible information to different stakeholders. we are looking for a person who has - good analytical skills and ability to translate data into actionable insights; - excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate across teams and influence stakeholders; - a passion for business, economy, finance and technology content; - experience in sql or other programming languages for data analysis (python, for example); - ability to read, write and communicate in english - teamwork: effective team player with strong interpersonal abilities. - proven skills in stakeholder management and influencing skills. - prioritization: keen sense of prioritization and task management. - knowledge of accounting and/or regulatory reports would be a plus - ability to read, write and communicate in spanish would be a plus. - familiarity with a banking business model would be a plus our benefits - chance of earning equity at nubank - food/ meal card (vale-refei√ß√£o and/or vale alimenta√ß√£o) - public transportation commuting benefit (vale-transporte) - nucare ‚Äì psychological, financial and legal assistance program - life insurance - medical plan - dental plan - nulanguage ‚Äì language course program - nucleo - our learning platform of courses - extended parental leave - daycare allowance - parental consultancy - work-from-home allowance - gym partnerships - 30 days of paid vacation our nu way of working our work model is hybrid and has cycles that can be from two to three months according to the business of expertise. for every eleven weeks of remote work, one will be at the office.

desc: descri√ß√£o completa da vaga  our company tenchi is a cyber security company building innovative technology focused on third-party cyber risk management for businesses. founded by serial entrepreneurs and supported by solid institutional investors, we are driven to disrupt this fast-growing industry. our flagship product, zanshin, gives enterprises clear and actionable visibility into the security risks posed by their critical third parties. in today‚Äôs interconnected world, sensitive data flows across countless partnerships, and organizations are accountable not only for their own security but for their entire ecosystem. zanshin streamlines compliance and risk management, especially within complex cloud environments, providing the insights companies need to protect their data and elevate their security posture. ‚Äå  our people and culture at tenchi, we believe that great technology is built by exceptional people. we foster a culture that inspires growth, collaboration, and purpose. our dna is rooted in intentionality, transparency, and a strong bias for action ‚Äî we move fast, communicate openly, and own our impact. we invest in individuals who bring passion, positivity, and a commitment to innovation. here, diversity is celebrated, backgrounds vary, but shared values unite us all. as a 100% remote company with team members across brazil, the us, canada, argentina, and spain, we embrace flexibility while coming together to solve meaningful challenges. if you‚Äôre ready to make an impact and thrive in a dynamic environment, tenchi is the place for you. watch this video to learn more about who we are and what drives us. ‚Äå  what will you do? - analyze and interpret complex, large-scale cybersecurity datasets to identify critical trends, risks, and opportunities for strategic action. - lead cross-functional collaboration with product, engineering, and client teams to architect, develop, and maintain advanced data-driven models and interactive visualizations that elevate user experience and drive business decisions. - design, optimize, and oversee complex data queries and pipelines across diverse data sources, ensuring high performance, accuracy, and scalability. - drive continuous improvement initiatives for data processing workflows and reporting frameworks, establishing best practices and standards across the team. - translate complex analytical findings into clear, actionable insights through compelling visualizations and comprehensive reports tailored to diverse stakeholder needs. - stay at the forefront of emerging data science, machine learning, and cybersecurity technologies and methodologies, proactively applying innovative approaches to enhance analytical capabilities and model robustness. - mentor and guide junior team members, fostering a culture of technical excellence, knowledge sharing, and ownership. requirements ‚Äå - advanced experience in python for data manipulation, statistical analysis, automation, and scripting. - expert proficiency in sql for complex data extraction, transformation, and in-depth analysis. - proven track record designing and delivering sophisticated visualizations that translate complex datasets into clear, actionable insights. - exceptional ability to communicate complex technical concepts and data-driven findings to diverse, non-technical audiences with clarity and impact. - strong understanding of cybersecurity concepts is highly desirable. - experience with formal risk assessment frameworks and scoring methodologies, regardless of industry, is a significant advantage. great if you have: - previous experience in the cyber security domain or familiarity with cybersecurity concepts. - contributions to open-source data projects or active participation in data science communities.

desc: trm labs is a blockchain intelligence company committed to fighting crime and creating a safer world. by leveraging blockchain data, threat intelligence, and advanced analytics, our products empower governments, financial institutions, and crypto businesses to combat illicit activity and global security threats. at trm, youll join a mission-driven, fast-paced team made up of experts in law enforcement, data science, engineering, and financial intelligence, tackling complex global challenges daily. whether analyzing blockchain data, developing cutting-edge tools, or collaborating with global organizations, youll have the opportunity to make a meaningful and lasting impact. as a data scientist, you will have end-to-end ownership of generating insights, developing custom models and building critical analytics products. in collaboration with a highly skilled team of engineers, data scientists, and blockchain analysts, your goal will be to uncover valuable and defensible information that can be used to detect, prevent, and mitigate cryptocurrency fraud and financial crime. the models and analysis you create will be specifically designed to identify new threat vectors that are unique to cryptocurrencies and blockchains. these analysis will be consumed by prestigious entities such as former fbi, secret service, and other law enforcement agencies, enabling them to stay ahead of evolving criminal activities in the cryptocurrency space. the impact you will have here: perform exploratory data analysis to uncover insights hidden in very large datasets and build compelling data-driven stories to support critical blockchain reports for industry leaders and global policy makers. lead the implementation of new advanced analytics products that allow our customers to explore and uncover hidden insights through complex blockchain data such as assessing the risk of defi services, stablecoins, global regulations and other crypto-trends. use your high-level business acumen to collaborate with our go-to-market team and work directly with our customers to understand their challenges and pain points in order to creatively translate them into impactful models and products. work closely with financial crime and threat analysts to identify suspicious activities, identify complex trends and generate impactful insights. collaborate with engineers and research scientists to design algorithms to analyze complex data structures inherent to cryptocurrencies and blockchains. this will involve working with distributed ledger technologies, cryptographic protocols, and transactional data to uncover suspicious activities. you will collaborate closely with engineers, data scientists, and threats analysts to align on project goals, methodologies, and deliverables. you will communicate your findings and insights effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. develop your skills through exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues establish best practices and statistical rigor around data-driven decision-making what we‚Äôre looking for: your academic background is in a quantitative field such as computer science, statistics, engineering, economics or physics. advanced degree preferred. you have 5+ years of experience working in an analytical role. you have a strong knowledge of relational databases, (e.g. sql) you think about data in terms of statistical distributions and have a big enough analytics toolbox to know how to find patterns in data and identify targets for performance you have experience exploring complex datasets to identify hidden insights and generate compelling stories you have customer facing experience and you enjoy sitting with the customers to understand their challenges. you have proven experience with at least one programming language (python preferred) and are comfortable developing code in a team environment (e.g. git, notebooks, testing). you have a high tolerance for ambiguity. you find a way through. you anticipate. you connect and synthesize. you are delivery-oriented, able to lead and execute in a face-paced environment. you have excellent verbal and written communication skills and experience in influencing decisions with information. about the team: the team operates with a high level of collaboration and interdependence, fostering an inclusive culture where connections extend beyond work. we value diverse personalities and seek someone who is both results-driven and sociable, with strong communication, leadership, and teamwork skills, along with a positive, solutions-oriented mindset. as a globally distributed team, members may observe different timezones. however, most of the team will overlap between the hours of 7am-12pm pst for meetings and collaboration. all team members, regardless of location must have at least 4 hour overlap with pst business hours. the team is involved in 2 different on-calls analytics on-call: only requires focus on working time (average of < 1 hour a day every month) data science on-call: full week on-call to ensure data science pipelines are running smoothly (average of 1-2 hours a day every 3 months) learn about trm speed in this position: deliver a last minute impactful project for a key customer build complex products effectively with tight timeframes (1-2 sprints for mvp) work on several projects in parallel with different priorities and stakeholders life at trm labs leadership principles our lps are foundational elements of our strategy, guiding how we make decisions, how we treat each other, and how we behave day-to-day. impact-oriented trailblazer ‚Äì we put customers first, driving for speed, focus, and adaptability. master craftsperson ‚Äì we prioritize speed, high standards, and distributed ownership. inspiring colleague ‚Äì we value humility, candor, and a one-team mindset. accelerate your career join a mission-driven team of industry leaders and make a real-world impact‚Äîdisrupting terrorist networks, recovering stolen funds, and more. at trm, you will: work alongside top experts and learn every day. embrace a growth mindset with development opportunities tailored to your role. take on high-impact challenges in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. thrive as a global team as a remote-first company, trm labs is built for global collaboration. we cultivate a strong remote culture through clear communication, thorough documentation, and meaningful relationships. we invest in offsites, regional meetups, virtual coffee chats, and onboarding buddies to foster collaboration. by prioritizing trust and belonging, we harness the strengths of a global team while staying aligned with our mission and values. join our mission! we‚Äôre looking for team members who thrive in fast-paced, high-impact environments and love building from the ground up. trm is remote-first, with an exceptionally talented global team. if you enjoy solving tough problems and seeing your work make a difference for billions of people, we want you here. don‚Äôt worry if your experience doesn‚Äôt perfectly match a job description‚Äî we value passion, problem-solving, and unique career paths. if you‚Äôre excited about trm‚Äôs mission, we want to hear from you. recruitment agencies trm labs does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. please do not forward resumes to trm employees. trm labs is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company without a signed agreement. privacy policy by submitting your application, you are agreeing to allow trm to process your personal information in accordance with the trm privacy policy learn more: company values | interviewing | faqs

desc: about the job ‚Äå we are` `tech transformation` `specialists, uniting human expertise with ai to create scalable tech solutions. with over 6,500 ci&ters around the world, we‚Äôve built partnerships with more than 1,000 clients during our 30 years of history. artificial intelligence is our reality. ‚Äå general description: we are looking for scientists who are passionate about data work with a mix of structured and unstructured, and use scientific methods and state-of-the-art techniques and tools to help our customers achieve their business objectives. ‚Äå responsibilities: understand complex business problems and translate them into structured data problems. capture and explore complex data sets (structured and unstructured data). prototype model of different complexity understand user behavior patterns, such as user engagement and segmentation, using machine learning models, to help test hypotheses. communicate findings effectively to an audience of engineers and executives. ‚Äå required qualifications: bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science/engineering, applied math, statistics, physics or other related quantitative areas. advanced oral and written communication skills in english. ability to understand mathematical models and algorithms in research papers, and to implement them into running software for proof-of-concepts and projects. ability to like regression, classification, clustering, dimensionality reduction, association rules, ranking and recommender` `[systems.](http://systems.experience/ "‚Äå") experience with natural language processing (nlp and nlu). experience using generative ai systems (e.g. chatgpt) and best practices (e.g. prompt engineering). understanding the key concepts on how to apply generative ai in building rag solutions (embeddings, dense search). business sense and consulting behavior to identify and breakdown problems, define and evaluate` `[hypotheses.think](http://hypotheses.think/ "‚Äå")` `critically and act in a detail-oriented fashion while keeping the "big picture" in` `[mind.ability](http://mind.ability/ "‚Äå")` `to provide creative and innovative approaches to problem` `[solving.ability](http://solving.ability/ "‚Äå")` `to work independently and within a collaborative team environment. ‚Äå desired qualifications: masters or phd in machine learning / data mining / statistics. experience in building advanced information retrieval or question answering systems using nlp and generative ai techniques (e.g. rag and graphrag).experience with construction and integration of knowledge graphs. ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå our benefits: ‚Äå -health and dental insurance -meal and food allowance -childcare assistance -extended paternity leave -wellhub (gympass) -totalpass -profit-sharing (plr) -life insurance -ci&t university -discount club -free online platform dedicated to physical, mental, and overall well-being -pregnancy and responsible parenting course -partnerships with online learning platforms -language learning platform and many more! more details about our benefits here:` `[https://ciandt.com/br/pt-br/carreiras](https://ciandt.com/br/pt-br/carreiras "smartcard-inline") ‚Äå ‚Äå ‚Äå collaboration is our superpower, diversity unites us, and excellence is our standard. we value diverse identities and life experiences, fostering a diverse, inclusive, and safe work environment. we encourage applications from diverse and underrepresented groups to our job positions.

desc: about the job ‚Äå at indi, were passionate about empowering individuals and businesses worldwide. our cutting-edge recruiters connect leading companies with top talent, fostering a dynamic environment where innovation thrives. join us in shaping the future of work. ‚Äå about the role: ‚Äå step into a world of data-driven innovation as our next data scientist, where youll be orchestrating the symphony of cutting-edge data products. this role is not just about crunching numbers; its about architecting the very foundation of how we deliver state-of-the-art solutions to industry giants and innovative startups alike. you will be unraveling complex business requirements, sculpting sophisticated machine-learning models, and weaving data magic to create actionable insights. armed with your profound knowledge of data science and machine learning, your role is to inject creativity and maintain superior standards in our energetic, tech-driven sphere. if youre passionate about building solutions that push the boundaries of whats possible with data, this is the place for you. ‚Äå what will i do? ‚Äå data product development: you will develop, deliver, and maintain data products using cutting-edge data science and machine learning techniques. ‚Äå collaborative innovation: your role is crucial in collaborating with product owners to develop impactful data products and services. ‚Äå ml application mastery: youll design and serve machine-learning and deep-learning applications, pushing the boundaries of ai. ‚Äå experimental design: youll conduct experiments with solid research methods and proper statistical analysis, ensuring data-driven decision making. ‚Äå data storytelling: youll tell compelling stories with data, translating complex insights for business-oriented people. ‚Äå required skills and qualifications: ‚Äå data science expertise: at least 4 years of experience wielding data science and machine learning to create powerful, scalable solutions. ‚Äå api integration: hands-on experience deploying machine learning models through rest apis. ‚Äå programming proficiency: mastery in python or r oriented to data science. ‚Äå database dynamo: experience with sql databases for in-depth data analysis. ‚Äå version control virtuoso: familiarity with version control systems, such as git. ‚Äå language luminary: advanced level of english for clear communication in our global environment. ‚Äå benefits: ‚Äå flexibility: choose where and how you work for enhanced creativity and innovation. ‚Äå tailored compensation: personalize your earnings to suit your financial goals. ‚Äå tech-driven tools: access cutting-edge resources for seamless collaboration and productivity. ‚Äå autonomous workflow: take control of your schedule to achieve work-life balance. ‚Äå well-being: enjoy generous leave policies for rest and rejuvenation. ‚Äå diversity & inclusion: thrive in our innovative and multicultural work environment. ‚Äå collaboration: engage with the global top 1% of talent for collective growth. ‚Äå development: access mentorship and growth opportunities for continuous advancement. if you are interested in being part of a team composed of the worlds top 1% of tech talent and working 100% goal-oriented in an innovative environment, but with the structure and resources of a multinational market leader, do not hesitate to apply!

desc: benef√≠cios retirados da descri√ß√£o completa da vaga - trabalho remoto    descri√ß√£o completa da vaga fraud warning: its common for scammers to create positions that look legitimate on other sites. to ensure your submission is considered, only apply for positions at sensor tower through our company website or through posts directly associated with sensor tower company profiles on sites such as linkedin, indeed, builtin or hackajob. at no point will sensor tower ever ask for money, credit card, or bank account information to complete a job application. communications received from sensor tower are only sent by e-mail addresses ending in [http://sensortower.com](http://sensortower.com "smartcard-inline") . all sensor tower interviews will be conducted via phone or zoom. at no time will a conversation be moved to an alternative email outside of [http://sensortower.com](http://sensortower.com "smartcard-inline") or text. should an issue arise that you feel we should be aware of, please contact us. please provide your resume when applying. ‚Äå to all recruitment agencies: sensor tower does not accept third party resumes. please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, sensor tower employees or any other organization location. sensor tower is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. sensor tower will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with sensor tower. ‚Äå about this role: ‚Äå we are seeking an outstanding data analyst interested in working in the hot space of mobile and digital analytics to join the data science organization at sensor tower. sensor tower is the gold standard for the mobile app market and first party data, leveraging a variety of data sources, machine learning algorithms, artificial intelligence, data science methodologies, and software engineering to create market estimates, market insights, and other kpi‚Äôs for mobile apps and publishers and beyond. we need self-driven and motivated performers who can take full ownership of the tasks they work on to join our stellar team. ‚Äå as a data analyst at sensor tower, you will help analyze, monitor, and deliver comprehensive and high-quality app market data to app professionals. you will be empowered to work independently with the support of team members spread across the world. you will also be the key contributor to the new and existing product data quality analysis and convert it into actionable insight. you will help build, maintain, and enhance the monitoring system with systematic and statistical measurements to ensure quality of the core intelligence data products. you will work closely with product managers, data scientists, and the engineering team to develop, sustain and improve our products and deliver estimates to customers with pride. ‚Äå  what you will focus on: - data profiling, data cleansing, data quality monitoring, and root cause analysis. - taking full responsibility for core intelligence product data quality. - deep understanding of the data structure and relationships in large, complex datasets. - owning regular data monitoring activities. - identifying and implementing improvements to monitoring and data quality control. - developing high-quality automated and reusable monitoring and improvement solutions to secure ongoing data quality. - working at the front lines to troubleshoot quickly and efficiently when issues arise. - handle client queries and ad-hoc requests from external teams to keep trust in our data quality. - perform in-depth analysis of new product quality and provide strong support to stakeholders such as product managers, data scientists, and engineers. - understand the end-to-end data pipeline and the methodology and work together with data scientists and engineers to suggest improvements. - developing quality indicators and diagnostic tests for implementation of machine learning models. - identifying relationships within large and seemingly unrelated data. - analyzing public data that could be used to complement current and future projects. - understanding the entire sensor tower products from a data point of view. - communicating well and clearly with teams and team members across multiple time zones, countries, and job functions.  skills we are interested in: - 2+ years of working experience in data quality or data analysis. - bachelors degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, statistics, or equivalent practical experience. - proficient in sql, python, r, or similar data analytic tools. - experience in statistical measurement design, quantitative data analysis, data query, data processing, and visualization. - experience in data visualization tools such as tableau, grafana, superset. - excellent problem-solving skills including analyzing problems and stories hidden by huge amounts of data. - being flexible enough to multitask and reprioritize tasks quickly based on the project needs. - an ability to work both independently and as part of a remote team to locate the root cause and come up with solutions. - strong presentation and communication skills. feel comfortable explaining the issues and solutions from analysis to the stakeholders from a wide variety of backgrounds, e.g. product managers, data scientists, and engineers, sales, etc. - self-motivated and strong ownership. be sensitive about any potential issues inside the production dataset. - great sense of accountability and attention to detail to proactively respond to troubleshooting. - becoming better at what you do every day.  nice to haves: - youre a tech fanatic (mobile app fanatic, a plus), positively curious, and a technology enthusiast. - experience with software engineering and writing production-level code. - experience working with mobile market intelligence data. - experience in big data or bi solutions, eg spark is a big plus. - experience with machine learning, data science workflows, or data pipeline design and automation. - experience with cloud computing and distributed systems. ‚Äå about sensor tower ‚Äå sensor tower cultivates responsibly sourced market intelligence that provides visibility into the trends shaping the global digital economy. our customers use these insights to help them make better business decisions. ‚Äå why sensor tower? ‚Äå our flexible work environment allows employees to live in greater connection with the people, places, and activities they love! ‚Äå our benefits for full-time positions include: - flexible time off so employees can shape their time away from work. - health and wellness stipend to achieve and maintain a healthy lifestyle through physical and mental fitness. - monthly internet stipend and a one-time $500 home office stipend. ‚Äå we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, and veteran status. we will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. if you have a disability or special need, please do not hesitate to let us know and well do our best to accommodate.

desc: about the job as we are a multinational company, you must submit your cv in english. _argus is where smart people belong and where they can grow. we answer the challenge of illuminating markets and shaping new futures._ it will be expected to work from 13:00 to 21:00 about twice a week in a hybrid work schedule. what we‚Äôre looking for as a data scientist, you will be responsible for keeping up to date on the latest research in the field of automatic machine learning and artificial intelligence and help guide the development of the argus methodology, algorithms & studio. much of the algorithms involves programming in r & sql. what will you be doing the primary focus of this role will be to make significant contributions to the development of versatile, readable, efficient and scalable r scripts. these will add to the development of argus‚Äô automatic machine learning (ml) and artificial intelligence (ai) capabilities. contributions also include the development and operational support of all the argus data science (ds) products with a particular focus on forward curves, possibility curves and our dashboards. key responsibilities - monitor and assess markets to produce daily price assessments, market analysis, news and reports. - daily contact with traders, brokers, investors and key market figures to build relationships and gather news. - find engaging ways to explain complex issues ‚Äì including using charts and graphics as appropriate. - help to build and curate data sets that help explain market dynamics. - attend meetings, conferences and industry events to build contacts, report on news and represent argus. - review existing and develop new methods for the argus possibility curves. - review existing and develop new methods for argus forward curves. - contribute to the development of the argus ds studio. - prototype algorithm techniques and run extensive benchmarks for all argus ds products. - engage in discussions with stakeholders to ensure smooth development of the ds products and commercial launch. - maintain current knowledge of the ai technology landscape and be able to identify emerging methods or technologies and best practices. - contribute to the enhancement of the argus ai/ml library for possibility & forward curves that can be used globally. - monitor the production processes for the argus ds products (such as possibility curves, forward curves, and the studio), identify if any issues arise and fix them to ensure that the curves are available to the clients before the deadlines. skills and experience - ba in statistics, computer science, finance, mathematics, engineering, or related stem field. - advanced r coding skills (3+ years). - good knowledge and experience of sql. - have experience in script development using version control (git and github). - have experience with exploratory data analysis and model/algorithm prototyping, selection, and validation. - have a good understanding of statistics and be familiar with a range of machine learning regression models (linear regression, etc). attributes - ability to engage in discussions and effectively communicate ideas in english. - maker mindset & self-directed. - passion for open source. - critical thinker. - team player. - comfortable working in a fast-moving environment with changing requirements. - strong problem-solving skills, able to think deeply about a business problem and devise a well-thought-out and pragmatic algorithmic solution. - you are comfortable with visualising and communicating data to various audiences, you easily articulate and present your ideas. what‚Äôs in it for you our rapidly growing, award-winning business offers a dynamic environment for talented, entrepreneurial professionals to achieve results and grow their careers. argus recognizes and rewards successful performance and as an investor in people, we promote professional development and retain a high-performing team committed to building our success. - pursuant to brazilian current legislation and for so long as such legislation shall remain in force, you are entitled to receive: - a christmas bonus (also called ‚Äú13th salary‚Äù), equivalent to one monthly salary. - a 30-day vacation period per year. - a vacation payment equivalent to one-third of your monthly salary. - a severance fund to de deposited in a special bank account (fgts), in the amount of 8% of your monthly salary. - benefits - health insurance ‚Äì sulamerica - dental insurance ‚Äì sulamerica - life insurance - prudential - pension plan - meal voucher - mobility allowance - pharmacy allowance - gym subsidy - parking about argus argus is the leading independent provider of market intelligence to the global energy and commodity markets. we offer essential price assessments, news, analytics, consulting services, data science tools and industry conferences to illuminate complex and opaque commodity markets. headquartered in london with over 1,500 staff, argus is an independent media organisation with 30 offices in the world‚Äôs principal commodity trading hubs. companies, trading firms and governments in 160 countries around the world trust argus data to make decisions, analyse situations, manage risk, facilitate trading and for long-term planning. argus prices are used as trusted benchmarks around the world for pricing transportation, commodities and energy. founded in 1970, argus remains a privately held uk-registered company owned by employee shareholders and global growth equity firm general atlantic. argus is committed to ensuring career and personal growth for all its staff and provides extensive training and career development opportunities, as well as participation in employee-led initiatives, including a women‚Äôs network. our core values are excellence, integrity, partnership and inclusivity. for more details about the company and to apply please make sure you upload your cv via our website:` `[http://www.argusmedia.com/en/careers/open-positions](http://www.argusmedia.com/en/careers/open-positions "smartcard-inline") argus is the leading independent provider of market intelligence to the benchmarks around the world for pricing transportation, commodities and energy. founded in 1970, argus remains a privately held uk-registered company owned by employee shareholders and global growth equity firm general atlantic.

desc: about the job the world is filled with connections. everything that exists by itself also exists in relation to everything else. people, things, places, actions, and so much more are connected in a complex web of interactions. any description of reality that does not take into account the connectivity between its elements is utterly incomplete. what the job entails: - in this job, you will join our efforts in the application of network science to our business. - you will use your programming skills to build and maintain pipelines that transform vanilla tabular data into informative graphs. - you will also use your analytical skills to come up with useful graph architectures, interpret graphs, visualize graphs, and experiment with different techniques to find interesting patterns hiding in graph data. - you will exercise your curiosity and creativity to propose solutions to problems. theres a plethora of tools, libraries, and algorithms that can be used to extract information from networks. choosing what to use requires research, experimentation, intuition, and initiative. - you will be part of a team of highly competent data analysts and data scientists. the ability and willingness to collaborate, participate in open discussions, offer and receive suggestions is essential. - you will be part of an exploration team inside the ai department. we take a step back from the day-to-day urgencies and pursue ambitious projects with high impact potential. - as a member of a fully remote and distributed team, you are expected to complete tasks autonomously, being highly collaborative and self-driven. we expect you to have the curiosity of a child with the responsibility of a grown-up. about cloudwalk: - cloudwalk is an ai-first fintech building its own technology to bring justice to the broken payment system in brazil. - some people say a company is a unicorn when it reaches a valuation of over 1 billion dollars. we are one of those companies. but we are also a much cooler type of unicorn: a freaking amazing beast that is incredibly rare, cool as hell and damn hard to catch. the ai team: - we love data. - we love living in a time when there‚Äôs access to an immense corpus of shared knowledge and incredible statistical and computational tools to extract meaningful information from the data. - we love thinking in high dimensions. - we like to explore before we exploit. - we sprinkle sci-fi references in everything we do. requirements: - fluency in python and sql. - you are not expected to have dense previous knowledge about graphs or network science. if youre smart, we can teach you. - initiative to learn, investigate, experiment. - communication skills. you should be able to communicate effectively with multiple teams. - ability to communicate and debate in english and portuguese. - solid data visualization skills to create charts and dashboards. - strong analytical skills, ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. - adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings. nice to have: - gcp or other cloud computing platform. - neo4j or other graph databases. - networkx/cugraph or other python libraries for graph manipulation. recruiting process outline: - online assessment: an online test to evaluate your basic programming skills and logical reasoning. - case: an open-ended technical case where youll have the chance to explore a toy graph dataset and extract insights. - technical interview and case presentation. - cultural interview. if you are not willing to take an online quiz and work on a test case, do not apply. diversity and inclusion: - we believe in social inclusion, respect, and appreciation of all people. we promote a welcoming work environment, where each cloudwalker can be authentic, regardless of gender, ethnicity, race, religion, sexuality, mobility, disability, or education.

desc: descri√ß√£o completa da vaga analyst (remote) _search title for senior associate, advisory (americas)_ ‚Äå ‚Äå at the reptrak company‚Ñ¢, our purpose is clear: to prove that doing and saying the right thing is good for business. this belief is at the heart of everything we do. ‚Äå ‚Äå our proprietary, patent-pending reptrak¬Æ model is the global standard for measuring and analyzing corporate reputation. built on over 20 years of longitudinal data and advanced data science and machine learning, it‚Äôs the only platform of its kind‚Äîcapturing over 1 million company ratings each year. ceos, ccos, boards, and executives at fortune 500 companies in more than 60 countries rely on it to understand stakeholder perception and guide business strategy. ‚Äå ‚Äå subscribers to the reptrak¬Æ program use our insights to protect business value and grow their positive societal impact. we help clients prioritize, implement, and prove the roi of their communications strategies, grounded in data. ‚Äå ‚Äå every day, we help the world‚Äôs leading companies navigate the realities of our time‚Äîpost-covid recovery, shifting policies, socio-economic and geopolitical disruption, and rising expectations around innovation and ethics. it‚Äôs meaningful work that reflects the shift from shareholder to stakeholder capitalism‚Äîand we‚Äôre proud to be at the forefront. ‚Äå ‚Äå the role as a senior associate in reptrak‚Äôs global advisory team, you will play a critical role in delivering high-quality, reputation-focused analysis, insights, and strategic recommendations to clients across the u.s., canada, and brazil. this is a fully remote role supporting a multi-region portfolio and contributing to high-impact client work. ‚Äå ‚Äå working closely with advisory team directors and peers, you will help leading global organizations translate complex data into meaningful business action. this role requires native proficiency in both english and portuguese to support our regional client base effectively and communicate insights across diverse markets. ‚Äå ‚Äå - serve as a key point of contact for a portfolio of clients, contributing to meetings and developing a strong understanding of each clients business priorities and stakeholder landscape. - analyze reptrak‚Äôs proprietary reputation data to identify key trends, stakeholder sentiment shifts, and strategic opportunities. - support client advisory across key domains, including brand and reputation, esg, corporate communications effectiveness, and risk management. - work collaboratively with senior team members to translate insights into actionable recommendations that solve complex business challenges. - create clear and engaging content‚Äîfrom strategic reports to visual presentations‚Äîthat effectively communicate data-driven narratives. - participate in the delivery of client presentations, preparing content and contributing insights that bring the data to life. - navigate power bi, excel, and the reptrak platform to surface insights and build reporting outputs with speed and accuracy. - actively align with the global advisory team, contributing to a shared set of processes, tools, and best practices that drive consistency and quality across all client work. ‚Äå ‚Äå professional qualifications required - 2‚Äì4 years of experience in strategy, market research, insights, branding, or communications, preferably in client-facing or data-focused roles. - native-level fluency in both english and portuguese, with the ability to collaborate effectively, present insights, and engage in strategic conversations with native speakers in brazil and north america. - demonstrated ability to translate data into compelling stories that influence decision-making. - strong multi-tasking, prioritization, and deadline management skills in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. - curiosity and adaptability in using ai-powered tools to improve client service, automate tasks, and contribute to evolving internal best practices. - excellent critical thinking, analysis, writing, and verbal communication skills. - proficiency in microsoft powerpoint and excel; experience with data visualization tools (e.g., power bi) is a plus. - bachelors degree in business, communications, marketing, social sciences, or a related field is preferred. ‚Äå ‚Äå work environment - this is a fully remote position, based in brazil, with alignment to clients and teams across the americas. - some travel may be required for client meetings, team sessions, or company events. ‚Äå ‚Äå compensation & benefits - the role includes a competitive base salary and eligibility for an annual performance-based bonus plan. - reptrak offers a comprehensive benefits package, including paid vacation, company holidays, and additional wellness and support programs. - the reptrak company is committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. we are proud to desc: want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? join cargills global team of 160,000 employees who use new technologies, dynamic insights and over 154 years of experience to connect farmers with markets, customers with ingredients, and people and animals with the food they need to thrive. job purpose the data analyst will develop an in depth understanding of the business to innovate significant data driven insights to help business leaders make better decisions and will develop and combine subject matter expertise in key data domains. in this role, you will act as a partner with internal stakeholders and technical staff to execute a business technology strategy that delivers reporting and analytics solutions for cargill‚Äôs transportation & procurement. accountabilities reporting & visualization: identify and analyze business needs, gather requirements and define the scope and objectives to drive business decisions. data collection & analysis: prepare data and explore new potential data to support reporting and analysis initiatives, including data ingestion processes. statistical analysis: prepare reports and analytical products to identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets for values and new opportunities. process improvement: lead analysis in collaboration with process and operations leadership to identify the top opportunities for improvement and track progress and impact on future results. collaboration: partner with the team to develop a detailed understanding of the business and offer mentorship or technical solutions to identify business problems. other duties as assigned qualifications bachelor‚Äôs degree in a related field or equivalent experience confirmed skills querying relational databases with query language confirmed experience working with large data stores proficiency with sql, python, and/or tableau/power bi experience in agile product delivery model experience querying database management systems preferred experience with transportation and/or procurement data functional knowledge of technology systems, including sap documentation skills/cataloging skill proven multi-tasking and project management skills at cargill, everyone matters and everyone counts. cargill is committed to creating and sustaining an inclusive and diverse work environment where all applicable national and local laws and regulations pertaining to non-discrimination and employment.

only english cvs will be accepted about the role - data gathering and analysis: collaborate with various functions within the customer experience organization to understand their reporting needs, collect relevant data from diverse sources, and perform thorough analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities. - report development: design and develop accurate and visually appealing reports, dashboards, and performance metrics using tools such as microsoft excel, looker, snowflake, or other reporting platforms and data warehouses. - data integrity: ensure data accuracy, consistency, and completeness throughout the reporting process. identify data quality issues and work with stakeholders to resolve them. - automated reporting solutions: streamline reporting processes by creating automated solutions that can be scheduled and distributed regularly, reducing manual effort, and increasing efficiency. - business insights: analyze report findings and translate complex data into clear and actionable insights. provide recommendations and strategic guidance based on data-driven insights. - ad-hoc analysis: conduct ad-hoc data analysis as required to support various business initiatives, special projects, or inquiries from stakeholders. - performance tracking: monitor and track key performance indicators (kpis) and provide regular updates on performance against targets. - data visualization: visualize data effectively to communicate complex information in a clear and concise manner, facilitating understanding and decision-making. - data maintenance and documentation: maintain documentation of reporting processes, data sources, and data definitions to ensure consistency and enable knowledge sharing within the team. - continuous improvement: proactively identify opportunities to enhance reporting capabilities, streamline processes, and optimize data workflows to improve data accuracy and reporting efficiency. - this is an independent contributor role.` ` skills & experience - bachelor‚Äôs degree in business, statistics, computer science, or a related field. - minimum 3 years working as a reporting analyst or similar role. - proficient in sql and experience with database management systems - proficiency in reporting tools such as microsoft excel, sql, looker, snowflake. - excellent data analysis and problem solving skills - solid understanding of data visualization principles. - strong attention to details and commitment to delivering high quality reports - thorough understanding and knowledge of analytics, metrics, and strategy. - exceptional written and verbal communication skills in english.` ` have we piqued your curiosity? sound like the role for you? we‚Äôd love to hear from you! even if you‚Äôre not 100% sure about potential fit, we still encourage you to apply. we‚Äôre looking for the right person, not the perfect series of checkboxes. mindbody is an equal opportunity employer. we highly value diversity at our company and encourage people of all different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives to apply. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or other protected characteristics. _by entering your email and phone number and submitting your application, you consent to receive emails, calls and sms about your application and other roles at mindbody, including by auto-dialer. message and data rates may apply. opt-out or text stop to cancel at any time. if you are a california resident or reside outside the united states then by submitting your application you confirm that you have read, understood, agree and - desc: about the job our purpose _mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. together with our customers, we‚Äôre helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. we support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential._ title and summary people reporting & data analyst: data operations overview mastercard is the global technology company behind the world‚Äôs fastest payments processing network. we are a vehicle for commerce, a connection to financial systems for the previously excluded, a technology innovation lab, and the home of priceless¬Æ. we ensure every employee can be a part of something bigger and change lives. we believe as our company grows, so should you. we believe in connecting everyone to endless, priceless possibilities. join a fast-growing team as a data analyst in the people and operational analytics team, you will. the data analyst is responsible for maintaining our data systems and reporting frameworks, guaranteeing the integrity and precision of data. the ideal candidate will transform raw data into structured information, which will then be analyzed to glean insights that drive strategic decision making in business. this position encompasses a comprehensive analysis lifecycle, covering requirement gathering, activity execution, and design planning. data analysts are tasked with enhancing analytical and reporting functions, as well as supervising performance and quality assurance processes to pinpoint areas for enhancement. role - data quality and integrity ‚Äå ensure that data is accurate, consistent, and reliable throughout its lifecycle, which is critical for making valid and trustworthy decisions cleanse data and scrutinize computer-generated reports and outputs to identify and rectify coding errors - collecting data from various sources ‚Äå gather data from various sources, including databases, apis, and third-party sources and ensure the upkeep of databases and data systems. - developing and supporting reporting processes ‚Äå create and maintain processes to generate accurate and timely reports that help stakeholders understand and act on key data insights identify opportunities for process enhancements engage with managers from various departments to specify data requirements for analysis projects tailored to their unique business processes - developing automated processes for data scraping ‚Äå design scripts and tools to automatically extract large volumes of data from databases, improving efficiency and availability. - interpret data ‚Äå detect, examine, and decode trends or patterns within intricate datasets employ statistical techniques to scrutinize data and produce actionable business insights your analyses will help extract meaningful insights and trends, which can then inform business decisions and strategies develop data dashboards, charts, and visual aids to support decision-making across departments - performs complex analyses ‚Äå conduct in-depth data analyses using advanced statistical methods and tools to uncover patterns, correlations, and insights - maintaining databases ‚Äå you will be entrusted with the responsibility of managing and updating databases to ensure they are secure, accessible, and functioning properly. your role is crucial in supporting ongoing data storage and retrieval needs. - collaboration ‚Äå coordinate with management to align business and informational priorities collaborate with the management team to determine and rank the needs of different business units possess a solid foundation in statistics and practical experience with statistical software (such as excel, power bi, tableau) and mastery in data analysis languages including sql, python, and r. exhibit exceptional analytical abilities to compile, structure, examine, and present substantial data sets with precision and thoroughness. capable of critically evaluating data to derive meaningful, actionable insights. demonstrate superior communication and presentation capabilities, adept at simplifying complex data insights for audiences without a technical background. a bachelors degree in computer science, information management, statistics, or a comparable discipline is required, with prior experience in data analysis or a related field being advantageous. all about you - possess a solid foundation in statistics and practical experience with statistical software (such as excel, power bi, tableau) and mastery in data analysis languages including sql and python. - exhibit exceptional analytical abilities to compile, structure, examine, and present substantial data sets with precision and thoroughness. - capable of critically evaluating data to derive meaningful, actionable insights. - demonstrate superior communication and presentation capabilities, adept at simplifying complex data insights for audiences without a technical background. - good troubleshooting and debugging skills. - proficient in standard software development, such as version control, testing, and deployment - demonstrated basic knowledge of statistical analytical techniques, coding, and data engineering - ability to solve complex problems with multi-layered data sets - ability to innovate and determine new approaches & technologies to solve business problems and generate business insights & recommendations. - ability to multi-task and strong attention to detail - flexibility to work as a member of a matrix based diverse and geographically distributed project teams - good communication skills - both verbal and written ‚Äì and strong relationship, collaboration skills, and organizational skills ‚Äå the following skills will be considered an asset. - people analytic experience - possess knowledge/expertise in data modelling and management techniques and strategies - technical expertise in data architecture principles and design aspects of various database management systems and reporting concepts - experience with visualization/reporting technologies (e.g. powerbi, tableau) - experience with data modelling and test data - fluent in english and portuguese. spanish desire. - bachelors degree required. ‚Äå corporate security responsibility ` `all activities involving access to mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, mastercard is responsible for information security and must: - abide by mastercard‚Äôs security policies and practices; - ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed; - report any suspected information security violation or breach, and - complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with mastercard‚Äôs guidelines. ‚Äå r-246441
